parameter.description: This parameter specifies the source path of the logs on the local machine. This source path can contain wildcards.

context.name: Ticket
context.description: This level is used to interact with ticket system (BroadSoft's problem reporting system). It is used to upload a file as an attachment to an existing ticket.

command.name: upload
command.description: This command is used to upload a document from the local server to an existing ticket.

parameter.name: UserId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket system user ID.

parameter.name: TicketId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket ID number. TicketId pattern is <String {1 to 10 characters}>-<Integer {1 to 9999999999}> or <Integer {10000 to 999999}>.

parameter.name: FileName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the file name of the file to be uploaded.

parameter.name: FileDescription
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the file to be uploaded.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket system user password.

context.name: Tools
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the tools entries.

command.name: backupdb
command.description: This command is used to back-up the content of the BroadWorks datastore to the specified file. '''NOTE 1''': Since the Application Sever uses a BroadWorks user ID, it cannot write an output file to a location for which it does not have write permission. For example, when using the "bwadmin" user ID, the bwadmin home directory cannot be used to write an output file. '''NOTE 2''': If no directory path is specified with the target file name, the default path''/usr/local/broadworks/bw_base''is used.

parameter.name: binary file where to backup the data
parameter.description: Indicates the target file name (output file) where the data is backed up. Note that you can also enter a directory path. However, if no path is specified the default path is used, which is /usr/local/broadworks/bw_base.

command.name: healthmon
command.description: This command is used to report the status.

command.name: importdb
command.description: This command is used to import the content of a remote Times Ten database in the current datastore. The remote server must have replication enabled.

parameter.name: remote server hostname
parameter.description: This is the remote server's host address, which can be a host name or IP address.

command.name: restoredb
command.description: This command is used to restore the content of the BroadWorks Times Ten datastore from the specified file. The content must have previously been backed up with the backupdb command.

parameter.name: file from which to restore the data
parameter.description: The binary file from which the data is restored.

command.name: tech-support
command.description: This command is used to capture the status of the system.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Tech-support includes some information extracted from log files on disk. Use the ''day'' option to get this information for a specific day in the month.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the date of a day in the month.

command.name: upgradeCheck
command.description: This command is used to perform a software activation dry run during which a system validation is performed to determine if the upgrade will be successful.

parameter.name: version to switch to
parameter.description: Specifies the version to which the system is upgraded.

context.name: Interface
context.description: The level is used to configure the system-wide interfaces available with the Network Server such as Application Server Registration (ASR), Media Server Selection (MSS), Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), and Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP).

context.name: ASR
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Application Server Registration (ASR) settings. The ASR works in conjunction with the redundancy functionality for primary and backup servers in a cluster to ensure on-going service during a primary Application Server failure condition. Each subscriber's active Application Server is known throughout the network so that in the event a subscriber's primary Application Server is unavailable, a backup Application Server can take over the ownership of the subscriber's directory number. Once the primary Application Server is available again, the subscriber's directory number ownership reverts to its primary Application Server. The ASR protocol ensures that the Application Server's active status is synchronized with the other Application Servers and the Network Servers on the network.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Application Server Registration (ASR)-related attributes including the listening port, the maximum number of retries per node, and the retransmission timer.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Application Server Registration (ASR)-related attributes including the listening port, the maximum number of retries, and the retransmission timer.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: maximumNumberOfRetriesPerNode
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of times the Network Server retransmits an Application Server Registration (ASR) request to a Network Server in the remote cluster.

parameter.name: retransmissionTimer
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time in milliseconds the Network Server waits to re-send an Application Server Registration (ASR) request to the remote cluster when the sending Network Server has not received a response.

parameter.name: listeningPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used by the Network Server to receive a request. This value must be aligned with the Application Server setting for Application Server Registration (ASR) listeningPort to work properly.

parameter.name: asrNumReceiveThreads
parameter.description: The number of the Application Server Registration (ASR) threads: that is, the threads that receive and process incoming ASR messages from Application Servers or remote Network Servers.

context.name: CallLog
context.description: This level is used to view and modify call logs. Call logs allow you to monitor the traffic generated by specific enterprises. A simple client is provided to store the logs to disk. This client can be run either on a remote machine or locally, although the latter is not recommended as the Network Server performance will greatly degrade. Only call processing transactions can be logged. Provisioning and trace tools transactions do not generate logs.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view call log-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify call log-related attributes.

parameter.name: CallLog
parameter.description: Call logging is off and call processing continues to work but no logs are generated.

context.name: CommonCommunicationTransport
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) settings. The BCCT mechanism is implemented as a generic framework for handling any protocol (for example, Operations Support System (OSS) or NetServerSync), which are to be transported over the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP)/IP or the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL). The framework provides both a server and a client-side implementation. It uses message wrappers to transport the protocol-specific messages while hiding it from the protocol handlers themselves. This way functionality, such as handshaking, can be done while not being exposed. This level is used to configure the maximum number of connections for each protocol, as well as a total number of connections. This level is also used to configure parameters, which are global to the framework. Parameters specific to each protocol are configured in each protocol's own context under the CommonCommunicationTransport level. The Interfaces level is used to configure the interfaces to bind for this protocol.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the global parameters of the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) framework.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the global parameters of the BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) framework.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: XSUnlimitedConnections
parameter.description: Specifies if the execution server process will accept unlimited connections from the provisioning server process.

parameter.name: false
parameter.description: Unlimited number of connections for the specified attribute.

parameter.name: XSMaxNumberOfConnections
parameter.description: The maximum number of connections the execution server will accept.

parameter.name: PSUnlimitedConnections
parameter.description: Specifies if the provisioning server process will accept unlimited number of connections.

parameter.name: false
parameter.description: Unlimited number of connections for the specified attribute.

parameter.name: PSMaxNumberOfConnections
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of connections the provisioning server will accept.

parameter.name: XSListeningPort
parameter.description: The listening port for the execution server.

parameter.name: PSListeningPort
parameter.description: The listening port for the provisioning server.

parameter.name: XSSecureListeningPort
parameter.description: The listening port for the execution server using SSL socket.

parameter.name: PSSecureListeningPort
parameter.description: The listening port for the provisioning server using SSL socket.

context.name: NetServerSync
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync) protocol settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is allows you to view the parameters associated with the Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync) protocol.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is allows you to modify the parameters associated with the Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync) protocol.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: unlimitedConnections
parameter.description: When set to true, this protocol accepts unlimited connections. When set to false, the number of connections is specified by the maxNumberOfConnections variable.

parameter.name: false
parameter.description: Unlimited number of connections for the specified attribute.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfConnections
parameter.description: The maximum number of connections the provisioning server will accept for the NS Sync API.

parameter.name: useSecureConnection
parameter.description: Specifies whether or not this protocol supports SSL sockets.

parameter.name: restrictInterfaces
parameter.description: When set to "true", public IP interfaces are not allowed to connect.

context.name: Interfaces
context.description: This level is used to view, add, or delete IP interfaces bound to this protocol. This allows you to limit the interfaces on which a remote host can connect. In practice, this prevents internal protocols from being accessed using public IP interfaces. The''allowed interfaces''is a parameter that only makes sense for the protocols that span multiple hosts; therefore the Operations Support System (OSS) and Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync) protocols have "allowed interfaces" lists.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of IP interfaces bound to the Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync) protocol.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync) interface.

parameter.name: interfaceAddress
parameter.description: The IP address of this interface.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync) interface.

parameter.name: interfaceAddress
parameter.description: The IP address of this interface.

context.name: OSS
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Operations Support System (OSS) protocol settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Operations Support System (OSS) protocol-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Operations Support System (OSS) protocol-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: unlimitedConnections
parameter.description: This protocol accepts unlimited connections.

parameter.name: false
parameter.description: Unlimited number of connections for the specified attribute.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfConnections
parameter.description: The maximum number of connections the provisioning server will accept for the OSS interface.

parameter.name: useSecureConnection
parameter.description: Specifies whether or not this protocol supports SSL sockets.

parameter.name: restrictInterfaces
parameter.description: When set to true, public IP interfaces are not allowed to connect.

context.name: Interfaces
context.description: This level is used to view, add, or delete IP interfaces bound to this protocol. This allows you to limit the interfaces to which a remote host can connect. In practice, this prevents internal protocols from being accessed using public IP interfaces. The "allowed interfaces" is a parameter that only makes sense for protocols that span multiple hosts; therefore the OSS and NetServerSync protocols have "allowed interfaces" lists.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of IP interfaces bound to the Operations Support System (OSS) protocol.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) Operations Support System (OSS) interfaces.

parameter.name: interfaceAddress
parameter.description: The IP address of this interface.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing BCCT OSS Interfaces.

parameter.name: interfaceAddress
parameter.description: The IP address of this interface.

context.name: Http
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, add, and delete the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) settings.

context.name: ClientAuthentication
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) client authentication properties.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Client Authentication properties.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Client Authentication properties.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: chainDepth
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum depth of the client Certification Authority (CA) certificates. The depth is the maximum number of intermediate client certificate issuers.

context.name: Trusts
context.description: This level is used to generate Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) trust anchors.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of Trust Anchors.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: You may specify hideChain to prevent the chain of certificate authorities from being listed.

command.name: createTrust
command.description: This command is used to generate a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) key and a trust anchor for a secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTPS) interface.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter describes a name specified by the administrator to identify uniquely a trust anchor.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter describes an optional attribute to be set.

parameter.name: keyLength
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key length or key size. (default value 2048 when not specified).

parameter.name: country
parameter.description: This parameter describes the country code international abbreviation code.

parameter.name: stateOrProvince
parameter.description: This parameter describes the state or province.

parameter.name: city
parameter.description: This parameter describes the name of the city.

parameter.name: organisationName
parameter.description: This parameter describes the organization name.

parameter.name: organisationUnit
parameter.description: This parameter describes the organization unit.

parameter.name: emailAddress
parameter.description: This parameter describes the e-mail address.

parameter.name: challengePassword
parameter.description: This parameter describes the challenge password.

parameter.name: commonName
parameter.description: This parameter describes the common name. Generally, the common name on a client certificate is the proper name of the organization requesting a certificate. Alternatively, it may follow any standard already determined within the organization owning the certificate.

command.name: deleteTrust
command.description: This command is used to delete a trust anchor identified by its alias name.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify which trust anchor to delete.

command.name: exportTrust
command.description: This command is used to export a file related to Secure Sockets Layer (SSL). The SSL file is extracted from the BroadWorks trust store and copied to the /var/broadworks/tmp directory.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify which trust anchor to export.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter is used to select which file type to export.

parameter.name: pkcs12File
parameter.description: This parameter indicates to export the certificate and key in a Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS#12) formatted keystore.

parameter.name: pkcs12Password
parameter.description: This parameter is used to specify the password used to secure the Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS#12) formatted keystore.

command.name: showTrust
command.description: This command is used to view the details of the X.509 certificate associated with the trust anchor of the provided interface.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify which trust anchor to display.

command.name: updateTrust
command.description: This command is used to load and update a trust anchor file. The certificate is taken from the specified path and copied to the proper location. If a trust anchor chain is provided, it is used for determining the certificate hierarchy when storing the trust anchor.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify which trust anchor to update.

parameter.name: trustAnchorFile
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify the file name for the trust anchor file.

parameter.name: trustAnchorChain
parameter.description: This parameter is used to identify the file name for the trust anchor chain.

context.name: WebApps
context.description: This level is used to view, add, and delete webapp entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of Web Applications where the Client Authentication applies.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Web Application where the Client Authentication applies.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

parameter.name: clientAuthReq
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the web application requests the client identity. When the value is set to 'true', the web application requests the client identity. When the value is set to 'false', the web application does not request the client identity. When a client receives a request for identity, it shall send its certificate.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a Web Application where the Client Authentication applies.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: clientAuthReq
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the web application requests the client identity. When the value is set to 'true', the web application requests the client identity. When the value is set to 'false', the web application does not request the client identity. When a client receives a request for identity, it shall send its certificate.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a Web Application where the Client Authentication applies.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

context.name: Resources
context.description: This level is used to view, add, and delete resource entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of resources for the Web Application where the Client Authentication applies.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a restriction to the scope of the Client Authentication.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

parameter.name: relativeUrl
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the relative url of the targeted resources.

parameter.name: clientAuthReq
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the web application requests the client identity. When the value is set to 'true', the web application requests the client identity. When the value is set to 'false', the web application does not request the client identity. When a client receives a request for identity, it shall send its certificate.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a restriction to the scope of the Client Authentication.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

parameter.name: relativeUrl
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the relative url of the targeted resources.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: clientAuthReq
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the web application requests the client identity. When the value is set to 'true', the web application requests the client identity. When the value is set to 'false', the web application does not request the client identity. When a client receives a request for identity, it shall send its certificate.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a restriction to the scope of Client Authentication.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

parameter.name: relativeUrl
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the relative url of the targeted resources.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) general settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) general settings.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) general settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: keepAliveTimeout
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the timeout for HTTP keep alive (required for profile tuning).

parameter.name: clientIOTimeout
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum length of time allowed for a client connection to be inactive. When the time elapsed since the last received or transmitted Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) packet reaches the timeout value, the connection is severed. The timeout value applies to cases where either the client or the server is not emitting packets.

context.name: HttpAlias
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, or delete the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server (Web Server) aliases. Whenever a web page is accessed, the web address in the URL that appears in the user's browser is replaced by the public address configured on this sever. If the server can be reached using alternate host names (and you do not want the address in the user's browser to be rewritten, when the web server is reached using those host names), you can add the host name to the list of recognized aliases.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to retrieve the list of Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) aliases.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) alias for a physical interface.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: clusterFQDN
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the cluster (for example, xsp1.mtl.broadsoft.com).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) aliases-related attributes for a given interface.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: clusterFQDN
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the cluster (for example, xsp1.mtl.broadsoft.com).

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) alias for an interface.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear a (set to know value) Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) aliases-related attributes for an interface.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

context.name: HttpBinding
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, or delete the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) bindings. Bindings associate an application to a specific server through an address and port combination.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to retrieve the list of Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) bindings.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) bindings.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the interface.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) binding.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the interface.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: applicationName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the web application accepting Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests on this interface.

context.name: HttpServer
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, add, and delete the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server settings. This level is also used to generate a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) key for a secure HTTP server and to load and update a new SSL certificate file.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) servers.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.description: This parameter controls server security.

parameter.name: clientAuthReq
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the server requests the client identity. When the value is set to "true", the server requests the client identity. When the value is set to "false", the server does not request the client identity. When a client receives a request for identity, it shall send its certificate.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: clusterFQDN
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the cluster (for example, xsp1.mtl.broadsoft.com).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server properties.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.description: This parameter controls server security.

parameter.name: clientAuthReq
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the server requests the client identity. When the value is set to "true", the server requests the client identity. When the value is set to "false", the server does not request the client identity. When a client receives a request for identity, it shall send its certificate.

parameter.name: clusterFQDN
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the cluster (for example, xsp1.mtl.broadsoft.com).

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server attributes.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface Internet Protocol (IP) address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Name of the attribute to clear.

command.name: sslExport
command.description: This command is used to export Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) files (certificate, key, or chain file). The SSL file is taken from its location and copied to the /var/broadworks/tmp/ directory.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This is the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) interface.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Used to select which file to export.

command.name: sslGenkey
command.description: This command is used to generate a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) key for a secure HTTP server. A generated ''.csr''(Certificate Signing Request) file is written to the ''/tmp'' directory under the name ''name.csr'', where name is the interface IP address.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This is the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) interface.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Optional attribute to be set.

parameter.name: keyLength
parameter.description: The SSL key length or key size, default value (when not specified) is "1024".

parameter.name: country
parameter.description: The country code international abbreviation code.

parameter.name: stateOrProvince
parameter.description: The state or province.

parameter.name: city
parameter.description: The name of the city.

parameter.name: organisationName
parameter.description: The organization name.

parameter.name: organisationUnit
parameter.description: The organization unit.

parameter.name: emailAddress
parameter.description: The e-mail address.

parameter.name: challengePassword
parameter.description: The challenge password.

parameter.name: commonName
parameter.description: The common name. It must correspond to the host name of this Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) server. A "*" wildcard character may be present in the left-most name component of the host if the certificate is to be used on multiple servers having the same domain. For example, the common name for host xsp1.broadsoft.com could be *.broadsoft.com or xsp*.broadsoft.com.

command.name: sslRemove
command.description: This command is used to remove the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) file (chain file).

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) interface.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The type of file to be removed.

command.name: sslShow
command.description: This command is used to view the details of the X.509 certificate and certificate chain associated with the provided interface. This command reflects the information as it is sent by the server to the client software.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the interface IP address.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

command.name: sslUpdate
command.description: This command is used to load and update a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate file. The certificate is taken from the specified path and copied to the proper location.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: Enter a specific IP address or select "ALL".

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) configuration attribute to update.

parameter.name: certificateFile
parameter.description: The file name of the certificate file.

parameter.name: keyFile
parameter.description: The file name of the certificate chain file.

parameter.name: chainFile
parameter.description: The file name of the key file.

context.name: LDAP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP).

context.name: Client
context.description: This level is used to view and modify attributes related to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client options.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client options.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: baseDistinguishedName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the distinguished name of the search base(for example, dc=broadsoft,dc=com).

parameter.name: bindPassword
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the credentials to bind to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the BroadWorks Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client is enabled.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client options.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

context.name: LocalUsers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) local users.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view local users.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add local user.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local user name for which the group membership lookups are not performed to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server. This can be useful in case of unavailability of the LDAP server.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete local user.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local user name for which the group membership lookups are not performed to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server. This can be useful in case of unavailability of the LDAP server.

context.name: Servers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) servers.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) servers.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: secured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies if secure communication is enabled.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server options.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number.

parameter.name: secured
parameter.description: This parameter specifies if secure communication is enabled.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

context.name: MSS
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the port used by the Network Server to listen for incoming Media Server Selection (MSS) requests from Application Servers.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the port used by the Network Server to listen for incoming Media Server Selection (MSS) requests from Application Servers.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the port used by the Network Server to listen for incoming Media Server Selection (MSS) requests from Application Servers.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port used by the Network Server to listen for MSS requests from Application.

context.name: NetServerSync
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync) Application Programming Interface (API).

command.name: get
command.description: Use this command to view the Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: Use this command to modify the Network Server Synchronization (NetServerSync)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: interClusterEnterpriseAllowed
parameter.description: Allows enterprises to spawn multiple HostingNe.

context.name: SIP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) settings. SIP information is required to establish communication between the Network Server and Network Elements (NEs).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: listeningPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port upon which the messages are received.

parameter.name: t1
parameter.description: The time to wait before re-transmitting is 500 milliseconds.

parameter.name: t2
parameter.description: The maximum time the interval between transmission attempts doubles is 4000 milliseconds.

parameter.name: GlobalCicEnabled
parameter.description: Controls the way the CIC is returned to Network Elements (NEs). If set to false, the CIC is returned without prefix. If set to true, the CIC is prefixed by +cc where cc is the country code of the call originator.

parameter.name: qmin
parameter.description: The minimum qvalue the Network Server can generate.

parameter.name: qmax
parameter.description: The maximum qvalue the Network Server can generate.

parameter.name: useViaHost
parameter.description: If set to false, the Network Server uses the Host from other field than the via header to identify to source HostingNE or RoutingNE. If set to true, the Network Server uses the Host from via header to identify to source HostingNE or RoutingNE.

parameter.name: useDNSLookup
parameter.description: When set to true, the server performs a DNS lookup on the host and then iterates through the results to find an address that matches a Hosting NE address. This is the default value. When set to false, the server does not perform a DNS lookup. It also assumes the caller is not calling from a Hosting NE.

parameter.name: sendLata
parameter.description: When set to false, the NS does not include the LATA in the contact list. When set to true, the NS does include the LATA in the contact list.

parameter.name: symmetricSignaling
parameter.description: Enables or disables symmetric signaling for SIP on the Network Server. Note that the system must be restarted for this change to be implemented.

parameter.name: supportDnsNaptr
parameter.description: Enables or disables DNS support for SIP on the Network Server.

parameter.name: supportTcp
parameter.description: Enables or disables TCP support for SIP on the Network Server.

parameter.name: SendE164
parameter.description: Enables or disables sending of E.164 numbers on the Network Server.

parameter.name: maxNumberTcpSocketsPerSystem
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of TCP sockets allowed for SIP.

parameter.name: maxNumberTcpSocketsPerPeer
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of TCP sockets allowed for communication with a specific IP address.

parameter.name: autoDiscardStaleConnections
parameter.description: When set to true, a connection will be released according to the value of the staleConnectionTimerInMinutes attribute.

parameter.name: staleConnectionTimerInMinutes
parameter.description: The amount of time a connection spends idle before it is considered stale.

parameter.name: addCICInSourceId
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Network Server should include the CIC parameter in the sourceID in case of Equal Access calls.

parameter.name: sendReasonHeader
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Network Server should send the Reason header.

parameter.name: supportRFC3966PhoneContext
parameter.description: Specifies whether RFC 3966 phone-context support is turned on or off.

parameter.name: redirectNumNonCallThreads
parameter.description: The number of non-call processing (SIP Non-CallP Redirect) threads, that is, threads that process any other incoming SIP messages (not INVITE or SUBSCRIBE [with line-seize Event]).

parameter.name: redirectNumCallThreads
parameter.description: The number of call processing (SIP CallP Redirect) threads, threads that process incoming INVITE or SUBSCRIBE (with line-seize Event) messages to find where this call should be redirected to.

parameter.name: sipNumNonCallReceiveThreads
parameter.description: The number of SIP non-call processing receive threads, that is, threads that receive and decode incoming SIP non-call processing messages (REGISTER, OPTIONS, and MESSAGE).

parameter.name: sipNumCallReceiveThreads
parameter.description: The number of SIP call processing receive threads, that is threads that receive and decode incoming SIP non-call processing messages (REGISTER, OPTIONS, and MESSAGE).

parameter.name: sipNumEncoderThreads
parameter.description: The number of SIP encoder threads, that is, threads that encode and send SIP outgoing messages.

parameter.name: useSessionCompletionTimer
parameter.description: When set to true, the session has to be completed according to the value of the sessionCompletionTimerMillis attribute.

parameter.name: sessionCompletionTimerMillis
parameter.description: The maximum time in milliseconds that the session completion is allowed to take.

parameter.name: udpReceiveBufferSize
parameter.description: Specifies the size of the SIP UDP receive buffer.

parameter.name: sipIpVersion
parameter.description: The IP version used by the SIP protocol.

parameter.name: viaHost
parameter.description: The IP or FQDN of the viaHost.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: SNMP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent.

context.name: AccessList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the list of entries in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the nodes that currently can access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a node to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list. To obtain performance measurements, the SNMP manager must have access to the individual nodes in the network. The SNMP manager Internet Protocol (IP) address is used by the agent to identify managers that are granted access.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of an external Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) manager.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a node from the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list. When the node is removed from the access list, it is longer able to obtain performance measurements from the SNMP Agent. The node's IP address is used to identify the manager.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of an external Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) manager.

context.name: Agent
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent settings, modify the listening port, modify the read community string, or modify the write community string. You can set the source address that is used to send traps, which supports configurations whereby a server can have multiple network interfaces, including a dedicated maintenance/management interface.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used to communicate to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether ISO-8859-1 or UTF-8 (Unicode) encoding is used by the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent to send traps.

parameter.name: readCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the read community string used to access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: writeCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the write community string used to access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: trapCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the trap community string used by the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent when sending SNMP Traps.

parameter.name: trapSourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the trap source for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: disableV2
parameter.description: This parameter is used to disable Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v2.

context.name: JVMStatsCollector
context.description: This level is used to configure the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector settings.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables or disables data collection for JVM statistics.

parameter.name: statisticsRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency at which BroadWorks fetches PMs from JVM Mbeans.

context.name: HeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: NonHeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the non-heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the non-heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the non-heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: Logging
context.description: This level is used to view and modify logging for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view logging-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify logging-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default logging severity level.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of the logging thread. The value "1" indicates the lowest priority and "5" indicates the highest.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the logging queue.

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.name: InputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear input channels entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view input channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging input channel on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the severity level of the logging input channel.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: OutputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear output channels.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view output channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify output channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging output channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging output channel on and off.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the directory where the log files are located.

parameter.name: filePrefix
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix of the log files.

parameter.name: fileSizeInMB
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of a log file.

parameter.name: numberOfFiles
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of log files that exist before the old log files are deleted.

context.name: Reporting
context.description: This level is used to view and configure the attributes related to the automated performance measurement (PM) reporting over the SNMP feature.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Performance Measurement (PM) reporting-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Performance Measurement (PM) reporting attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: active
parameter.description: If true, enables automated PM reporting.

parameter.name: intervalMin
parameter.description: PM reporting frequency in minutes.

parameter.name: resetCounters
parameter.description: If true, automatically resets all counters after generating a report.

parameter.name: reportTable
parameter.description: If true, include table-specific counters in the report.

command.name: generateReport
command.description: This command is used to generate a Performance Measurement (PM) report and send it to remote File Transfer Protocol (FTP) servers. This command does not reset counters (even when resetCounters is enabled).

context.name: FTP
context.description: The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) level is used to view and modify the target FTP servers for Performance Measurement (PM) reporting.

command.name: get
command.description: Use this command to view File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: Use this command to add a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.description: The IP address, host name, or domain of a target FTP server to be deleted.

parameter.name: userid
parameter.description: User ID to use when logging in to the target FTP server.

parameter.name: usePassiveMode
parameter.description: Use FTP passive mode when connecting to the remote FTP server.

command.name: set
command.description: Use this command to modify the information associated with the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.description: The IP address, host name, or domain of a target FTP server to be deleted.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: usePassiveMode
parameter.description: Use FTP passive mode when connecting to the remote FTP server.

command.name: delete
command.description: Use this command to delete an existing File Transfer Protocol (FTP) serve.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.description: The IP address, host name, or domain of a target FTP server to be deleted.

context.name: SMAP
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, and delete Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the length of time that the agent waits for a server's response to its requests (in seconds).

context.name: BCCT
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP) BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT)-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP) BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT)-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP) BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number for the Software Management Application Protocol (SMAP) BroadWorks Common Communication Transport (BCCT) Channel.

context.name: TrapTable
context.description: This level is used to view and modify entries in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view information in the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table, such as the IP address of the machine the BroadWorks server is sending traps to and the corresponding port.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a node to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table. To send traps, the BroadWorks server must be able to identify the node where traps are sent. This is usually a machine designated as the central point for monitoring. The node's IP address and port are used to identify the node.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: This parameter determines how Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) traps are sent. When the value is set to "shared", the SNMP Agent wraps every trap in an envelope with the same name. The recipient can receive three different types of envelopes: a notification, an alarm, or a software error. The content of the envelope provides an explanation of the source of the problem. When the value is set to "unique", the SNMP Agent sends every instance of a notification in a different envelope. Each of these uniquely identifies the problem without having to open the envelope.

parameter.name: useAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the system sends pairs of notifications or alarms. This is a backward-compatibility flag.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify an entry in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: This parameter determines how Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) traps are sent. When the value is set to "shared", the SNMP Agent wraps every trap in an envelope with the same name. The recipient can receive three different types of envelopes: a notification, an alarm, or a software error. The content of the envelope provides an explanation of the source of the problem. When the value is set to "unique", the SNMP Agent sends every instance of a notification in a different envelope. Each of these uniquely identifies the problem without having to open the envelope.

parameter.name: useAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the system sends pairs of notifications or alarms. This is a backward-compatibility flag.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a node from the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table. Nodes removed from the SNMP trap table are no longer sent traps. The node's IP address and port are used to identify the node.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

context.name: V3AccessControl
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 Access Control level.

context.name: Groups
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 groups.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 groups-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 groups.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

context.name: AccessLevels
context.description: This level is used to view and modify levels of access for the group.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 group access levels.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 access levels to a group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a level of access for the group. When the value is set to "all", complete access is provided; when the value is set to "management", access to the managed objects is provided; when the value is set to "performance", access to the performance measurements is provided.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 access levels from a group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a level of access for the group. When the value is set to "all", complete access is provided; when the value is set to "management", access to the managed objects is provided; when the value is set to "performance", access to the performance measurements is provided.

context.name: V3Users
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, delete and clear the V3 User level attributes. The V3 User level provides support for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) version 3 (SNMPv3). The primary feature of SNMPv3 is additional security. The only security feature in SNMPv2 is the support of community strings (that can be viewed as a simple password with no user name). SNMPv3 supports multiple user name/password pairs, as well as encryption. System administrators are able to configure the version of SNMP that BroadWorks should support (v2 or v3), as well as parameters specific to each version. View-based Access Control Model (VACM) is supported with three predefined views: all, management and performance. It is configurable through the V3 user group attribute and the V3AccessControl level.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

parameter.name: read
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for read access.

parameter.name: write
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for write access.

parameter.name: security
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the security implemented for this Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: authenticationKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user authentication key.

parameter.name: privacyKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the privacy key used for encryption.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 group name.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user-related attributes.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: read
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for read access.

parameter.name: write
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for write access.

parameter.name: security
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the security implemented for this Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.name: authenticationKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user authentication key.

parameter.name: privacyKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the privacy key used for encryption.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 group name.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user-related attributes.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: ServiceControlProxy
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Service Control Proxy settings. The Service Control Proxy interface on the Network Server provides a single point of contact for a Service Control Point (SCP) into BroadWorks. The Service Control Proxy interface handles the communication between the SCP, on the client-side, and the Application Server, on the server-side. The Service Control Proxy interface works with a Network Control List (NCL).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Service Control Proxy-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Service Control Proxy-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: httpUrlPattern
parameter.description: The HTTP URL used by a SCP to access the Network Server. The default is: http://<NetworkServerAddress>/ServiceControlExecute.jsp. When customized, the.jsp suffix is automatically appended. For example, if the url-pattern is changed to RunEnhancedServices, the SCP uses http://<NetworkServerAddress>/RunEnhancedServices.jsp. "NOTE": Changes must be done manually for each Network Server in a cluster.

parameter.name: enableServiceControlProxy
parameter.description: When set to "true" the Service Control Proxy feature is enabled. When set to "false" the Service Control Proxy feature is disabled.

parameter.name: numberOfChannelPerAS
parameter.description: This is the number of channels allocated for each Application Server. By default, the Network Server establishes two TCP/IP connections to each Application Server and tracks whether an Application Server is available or not. An Application Server is flagged as unavailable when all of its TCP/IP connections are flagged as unavailable.

parameter.name: remoteWspPort
parameter.description: The remote Wholesale protocol port number.

parameter.name: reconnectTimeoutSeconds
parameter.description: The interval, in seconds, at which the Network Server tries to restore unavailable TCP connections.

parameter.name: failoverTimeoutSeconds
parameter.description: When the Network Server receives no response from the Application Server within the specified time (failoverTimeoutSeconds) it marks the connection as unavailable and tries an available connection on the non-hosting Application Server.

context.name: System
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the basic system information. It is used to configure platform information such as the system name and IP addresses and supporting protocols such as Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP), Media Server Selection (MSS), Application Server Registration (ASR), and peer Network Servers. As well, you can upload data from the Application Server to the Network Server at the time of installation, you can load new routing policies for use by the Network Server, and you can verify translations. Licensing agreement information can be loaded and viewed. Call processing information- translations, SIP event treatments, call type definitions, country and national destination codes and dial plans- can also be configured.

context.name: Alias
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Network Server aliases.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Network Server aliases.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Network Server aliases.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: An IP address, host name, or domain name you want to assign to the Network Server.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete Network Server aliases.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.description: A Network Server alias.

context.name: CallP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the call processing information settings. Configuration on the Network Server for call processing involves translations, SIP error code treatments, call type definitions, country and national destination codes, and dial plans.

context.name: CallTypes
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the call types. Call type definitions are used to manage call types used by policies and dial plans. E.164 FormatThe sendE164 parameter that is set under the Interfaces/SIP context can be used to force the Network Server to send all called numbers that can be normalized in E.164 format, that is, +CC-NDC-STNID. The supportE164 parameter at the System/CallP/CallTypes context provides a mechanism to disable the E.164 encoding when the call is sent to specific call types.'''NOTE''': The supportE164 parameter does not change the send164 behavior other than what is described. (Even with this feature, send164 only applies to calls routed to a RoutingNE or HostingNE that has E164Compliant set as a signaling attribute.)When a contact is added by a Network Server policy, the Network Server checks the following elements before forcing a contact to be in the E.164 format:If the send164 flag is enabled. If the called number was normalized to an E.164 number. If the target host, RoutingNE or HostingNE, has E.164Compliant set as a signaling attribute.
