If the call type supports E.164.By default, all call types can be formatted in the E.164 format whenever the called number can be normalized.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view and modify the call type-related attributes, such as the call type category and description. Use the command alone to display all records. Use the command with a specified variable to show records matching the criteria specified.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: CallType
parameter.description: The call type code is used by policies to identify the type of call being handled. Some codes are system defined and the administrator can add others.

parameter.name: Desc
parameter.description: A description of the call type.

parameter.name: Category
parameter.description: This call type is categorized as local.

parameter.name: SupportE164
parameter.description: Specifies is the call type does not support the E.164 format.

parameter.name: Charge
parameter.description: Indicates if the call type should be chargeable or not.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a call type. The call type code, category, and E164 support indicator are also set with this command.

parameter.name: CallType
parameter.description: The call type code is used by policies to identify the type of call being handled. Some codes are system defined and the administrator can add others.

parameter.name: Category
parameter.description: This call type is categorized as local.

parameter.name: SupportE164
parameter.description: The call type does not support the E.164 format.

parameter.name: Charge
parameter.description: Indicates if the call type should be chargeable or not.

parameter.name: Desc
parameter.description: A description of the call type.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify call type definition-related attributes, such as the category and description.

parameter.name: CallType
parameter.description: The call type code.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: Desc
parameter.description: A description of the call type.

parameter.name: Category
parameter.description: This call type is categorized as local.

parameter.name: SupportE164
parameter.description: Specifies is the call type does not support the E.164 format.

parameter.name: Charge
parameter.description: Indicates if the call type should be chargeable or not.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete call type definition-related attributes. The unique call type code is used to delete the associated record.

parameter.name: CallType
parameter.description: The call type code.

context.name: CountryCodes
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the country and national destination codes. These codes fully support and decode E.164 phone numbers. An E.164 number is a globally defined phone number composed of a country code (CC), national destination code (NDC), and station code (STNC), in that order. Although the Network Server comes with an up to date pre-filled country code table, you can add a new country code, delete an existing country code, query existing country codes, and modify country code attributes. National destination code data allows you to define the phone number format for each country code.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view country code-related attributes.

parameter.name: -cc
parameter.description: Filter based on a country code.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the country.

parameter.name: fixedDnLength
parameter.description: The length of the DN entry.

parameter.name: intlPfx
parameter.description: The International country prefix.

parameter.name: natlPfx
parameter.description: The National country prefix.

parameter.name: carrPfx
parameter.description: The Carrier prefix.

parameter.name: intraPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for intra-LATA calls.

parameter.name: interPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for inter-LATA calls.

parameter.name: intlPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for international calls.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: The routing profile for this enterprise.

parameter.name: intlCarrPfx
parameter.description: The international carrier prefix. It is used as a prefix in the returned contacts when addCICasCAC is enabled within an applicable policy and the call is an international call. If set to an empty string, no CAC is added as a prefix for international calls.

parameter.name: stripPfx
parameter.description: Set to true to strip the national/international prefix from the returned contacts when addCICasCAC is enabled within an applicable policy. The default value is false.

context.name: DialPlan
context.description: This level is used to view and modify dial plans. Dial plans are defined using internationally recognized country codes and are a list of acceptable dialed digits on the system.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view dial plans.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: dialPlan
parameter.description: The dial plan name.

parameter.name: init
parameter.description: If set to false, indicates that this dial plan is an alternate dial plan, which can be called from the initial dial plan or another alternate dial plan. If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a call made to a number hosted for this country has the called party number expressed as dialed digits.

parameter.name: e164init
parameter.description: If set to false, indicates that this E.164 dial plan is an alternate E.164 dial plan that can be called from the initial E.164 dial plan or another alternate E.164 dial plan. If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a call made to a number hosted for this country has the called party number expressed as a global E.164 phone number.

parameter.name: smsInit
parameter.description: If set to false, indicates that this SMS dial plan is an alternate SMS dial plan that can be called from the initial SMS dial plan or another alternate SMS dial plan. If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a SMS call is made to a number hosted for this country.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a dial plan.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: dialPlan
parameter.description: The dial plan name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: An additional attribute to configure against the country code.

parameter.name: init
parameter.description: If set to false, indicates that this dial plan is an alternate dial plan, which can be called from the initial dial plan or another alternate dial plan. If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a call made to a number hosted for this country has the called party number expressed as dialed digits.

parameter.name: e164init
parameter.description: If set to false, indicates that this E.164 dial plan is an alternate E.164 dial plan that can be called from the initial E.164 dial plan or another alternate E.164 dial plan. If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a call made to a number hosted for this country has the called party number expressed as a global E.164 phone number.

parameter.name: smsInit
parameter.description: If set to false, indicates that this SMS dial plan is an alternate SMS dial plan that can be called from the initial SMS dial plan or another alternate SMS dial plan. If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a SMS call is made to a number hosted for this country.

parameter.name: dialPlan

If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a call made to a number hosted for this country has the called party number expressed as dialed digits.

parameter.name: e164init
parameter.description: If set to false, indicates that this E.164 dial plan is an alternate E.164 dial plan that can be called from the initial E.164 dial plan or another alternate E.164 dial plan. If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a call made to a number hosted for this country has the called party number expressed as a global E.164 phone number.

If set to true, indicates that this dial plan is the country's initial dial plan used by the Network Server when a SMS call is made to a number hosted for this country.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: dialPlan
parameter.description: The dial plan name.

context.name: Entry
context.description: This level is used to view and modify dial plan entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view dial plan entries.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: dialPlan
parameter.description: The dial plan name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits included in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits included in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: match
parameter.description: Digit matching rules: *exact: The compared digits must match exactly. *suffix: Must match the trailing digits. prefix: Must match the leading digits.

parameter.name: min
parameter.description: The minimum number of digits required in the number being analyzed.

parameter.name: max
parameter.description: The maximum number of digits allowed in the number being analyzed.

parameter.name: callType
parameter.description: The type of call.

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.description: The number of digits that are considered as prefix digits in the number being analyzed.

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: List of actions that describe the type of call being identified.

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: The alternateCallIndicator attribute is used in communication between the Application Server and the Network Server to identify if a call is an expensive call. It only appears in the 302 Moved Temporarily message and only if the response is sent to a hosting NE configured with the CallTypeInfoRequired signaling attribute. It is a list of contact parameters to be added to the response. Each parameter is either a token or a token=value and parameters are separated by semi-colons. Tokens and values can only contain the following characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, or : -.!%*_+`'~. The following tokens, which are already known on the Network Server cannot be used: ct, cat, ton, or q. Examples for a valid alternateCallIndicator include:aci=exptoken1;token2=value2;token3.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: Description of the purpose of this entry.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add dial plan entries. Dial plan entries can be overlapping as long as they can be distinguished by a non-overlapping min-max setting. For example, 1800 1800 7 7 and 1800 1800 11 11 can both be provisioned.

parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: dialPlan
parameter.description: The dial plan name.

parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: max
parameter.description: The maximum number of digits allowed in the number being analyzed.

parameter.name: callType
parameter.description: The type of call.

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.description: The number of digits that are considered as prefix digits in the number being analyzed.

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: A list of actions that describe the type of call being identified.

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: The alternateCallIndicator attribute is used in communication between the Application Server and the Network Server to identify if a call is an expensive call. It only appears in the 302 Moved Temporarily message and only if the response is sent to a hosting NE configured with the CallTypeInfoRequired signaling attribute. It is a list of contact parameters to be added to the response. Each parameter is either a token or a token=value and parameters are separated by semi-colons. Tokens and values can only contain the following characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, or : -.!%*_+`'~.The following tokens, which are already known on the Network Server cannot be used: ct, cat, ton, or q. Examples for a valid alternateCallIndicator include:aci=exptoken1;token2=value2;token3.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: Description of the purpose of this entry.

Tokens and values can only contain the following characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, or : -.!%*_+`'~. The following tokens, which are already known on the Network Server cannot be used: ct, cat, ton, or q. context.name: NDC
context.description: This level is used to view and modify National Destination Code (NDC)-related attributes, such as the corresponding country code, the national destination code (NDC) range, the description of the range, the minimum and maximum length of the station code, and the actual number of digits allowed in an NDC.

command.name: get
command.description: National Destination Codes (NDCs) are displayed using this command.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: ndc
parameter.description: An ndc range, for example from 700 to 702.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Description of the National Destination Code (NDC) describing the region covered.

parameter.name: minStncLength
parameter.description: Minimum length of the station code for a phone number stating with the current country code and an NDC in the current range.

parameter.name: maxStncLength
parameter.description: Maximum length of the station code for a phone number stating with the current country code and an NDC in the current range.

parameter.name: ndcLength
parameter.description: For the current National Destination Code (NDC) range, the actual number of digits that are allowed in an NDC.

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name. Must be unique within the country code.

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name. Must be unique within the zone.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The local calling area name. Must be unique within the entire system.

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: Used in communication between the Application Server and the Network Server to identify if a call is an expensive call. It only appears in the 302 Moved Temporarily message and only if the response is sent to a Hosting NE configured with the CallTypeInfoRequired signaling attribute. It is a list of contact parameters to be added to the response. Each parameter is either a token or a token=value and parameters are separated by semi-colons. Tokens and values can only contain the following characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, or : -.!%*_+`'~. The following tokens, which are already known on the Network Server cannot be used: ct, cat, ton, or q. Examples of a valid alternateCallIndicator include:aci=exptoken1;token2=value2;token3.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a National Destination Code (NDC). When a new NDC is added to the system, the corresponding country code, the national destination code (NDC) range, the description of the range, the minimum and maximum length of the station code, and the actual number of digits allowed in an NDC are set.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Description of the National Destination Code (NDC) describing the region covered.

parameter.name: minStncLength
parameter.description: Minimum length of the station code for a phone number stating with the current country code and an NDC in the current range.

parameter.name: maxStncLength
parameter.description: Maximum length of the station code for a phone number stating with the current country code and an NDC in the current range.

parameter.name: ndcLength
parameter.description: For the current National Destination Code (NDC) range, the actual number of digits that are allowed in an NDC.

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name. Must be unique within the country code.

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name. Must be unique within the zone.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The local calling area name. Must be unique within the entire system.

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: Used in communication between the Application Server and the Network Server to identify if a call is an expensive call. It only appears in the 302 Moved Temporarily message and only if the response is sent to a Hosting NE configured with the CallTypeInfoRequired signaling attribute. It is a list of contact parameters to be added to the response. Each parameter is either a token or a token=value and parameters are separated by semi-colons. Tokens and values can only contain the following characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, or : -.!%*_+`'~ The following tokens, which are already known on the Network Server cannot be used: ct, cat, ton, or q. Examples of a valid alternateCallIndicator include: aci=exp token1;token2=value2;token3.

command.description: This command is used to modify National Destination Code (NDC)-related attributes, such as the national destination code (NDC) range, the description of the range, the minimum and maximum length of the station code, and the actual number of digits allowed in an NDC.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Description of the National Destination Code (NDC) describing the region covered.

parameter.name: minStncLength
parameter.description: Minimum length of the station code for a phone number stating with the current country code and an NDC in the current range.

parameter.name: maxStncLength

parameter.name: ndcLength
parameter.description: For the current National Destination Code (NDC) range, the actual number of digits that are allowed in an NDC.

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name. Must be unique within the country code.

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name. Must be unique within the zone.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The local calling area name. Must be unique within the entire system.

parameter.name: alternateCallIndicator
parameter.description: Used in communication between the Application Server and the Network Server to identify if a call is an expensive call. It only appears in the 302 Moved Temporarily message and only if the response is sent to a Hosting NE configured with the CallTypeInfoRequired signaling attribute. It is a list of contact parameters to be added to the response. Each parameter is either a token or a token=value and parameters are separated by semi-colons. Tokens and values can only contain the following characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, or : -.!%*_+`'~.The following tokens, which are already known on the Network Server cannot be used: ct, cat, ton, or q. Examples of a valid alternateCallIndicator include:aci=exptoken1;token2=value2;token3.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a National Destination Code (NDC). The unique country code and national destination code (NDC) range combination is used to delete the associated record.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending National Destination Code (NDC) of the NDC range.

context.name: LCA
context.description: This level is used to create Local Calling Areas (LCA). An LCA cannot cross country code boundaries. The creation of a local calling area is inclusive, meaning that entities added form the local calling area. There is no provision to exclude a smaller entity from a bigger one already included in the local calling area.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Local Calling Areas (LCA)-related attributes.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The local calling area name.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The local calling area name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The local calling area name.

parameter.name: ndc
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name(s).

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Local Calling Areas (LCA). If it already exists, the specified rules are added to the existing LCA.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The local calling area name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: ndc
parameter.description: The national dialing code(s).

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name(s).

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name(s).

parameter.name: otherLcaid
parameter.description: Other local calling area name(s).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Local Calling Areas (LCA)-related attributes in the system, replacing all existing rules by those specified using the command. A warning is output to request confirmation of changes.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The local calling area name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: ndc
parameter.description: The national dialing code(s).

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name(s).

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name(s).

parameter.name: otherLcaid
parameter.description: Other local calling area name(s).

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Local Calling Areas (LCA) and can also be used to delete LCA rules from an existing LCA.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The local calling area name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: ndc
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name(s).

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name(s).

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name(s).

parameter.name: otherLcaid
parameter.description: Other local calling area name(s).

context.name: Zones
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the zone. A zone is the Network Server name given to the concept of LATA in countries other than country code 1 (North America). That is, it defines a geographic area covered by one or more local telephone companies.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display zone and rate center attributes.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name.

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: A description of the zone.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new zone/rate center.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name.

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: A description of the zone.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify zone/rate center attributes.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name.

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: A description of the zone.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing zone/rate center.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: zone
parameter.description: The zone name.

parameter.name: rateCenter
parameter.description: The rate center name.

context.name: DMI
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, and delete digit-manipulation related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view digit manipulation-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index number.

parameter.name: dmStr
parameter.description: The digit manipulation string or algorithm associated with the index number.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: The description of the digit manipulation string.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to view digit manipulation-related attributes. When adding a new digit manipulation to the system, the index number, the digit manipulation string, and the description are set. The algorithm for the digit manipulation string (dmStr) is entered using the following syntax:

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index number.

parameter.name: dmStr
parameter.description: The digit manipulation string or algorithm associated with the index number.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: The description of the digit manipulation string.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify digit manipulation-related attributes, such as the index number, digit manipulation string, and description. The unique index number is used to identify the associated record. The algorithm for the digit manipulation string (dmStr) is changed using the following syntax:

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: dmStr
parameter.description: The digit manipulation string or algorithm associated with the index number.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: The description of the digit manipulation string.

command.name: delete
command.description: his command is used to delete digit manipulation-related attributes. The index number is used to delete the associated record.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index number.

context.name: GETS
context.description: This level is used to view and modify GETS-related attributes.

command.description: This command is used to view GETS-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify GETS-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.description: This parameter controls whether GETS is enabled on the system.

parameter.name: signalingDSCP
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the signaling DSCP value used for GETS SIP traffic.

parameter.name: sipUdpPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the From port for outgoing GETS SIP UDP signaling.

parameter.name: sipTcpPort
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the From port for outgoing GETS SIP TCP signaling.

parameter.name: errorEtsX
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the provisioned ets.x value used in the Resource-Priority SIP header for some GETS error scenarios.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear (set to no value) GETS-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: ResourcePriorities
context.description: This level is used to view, add, and delete resource priorities values.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view resource priorities values.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a resource priority value.

parameter.name: priorityValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies one recognized Resource-Priority r-value, made of a namespace, a dot, and a priority value, as per RFC 4412. Examples are 'ets.2' and 'dsn.flash'. Values are case-insensitive.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a resource priority value.

parameter.name: priorityValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies one recognized Resource-Priority r-value, made of a namespace, a dot, and a priority value, as per RFC 4412. Examples are 'ets.2' and 'dsn.flash'. Values are case-insensitive.

context.name: Options
context.description: This level is used to get or modify Call Processing (CallP)Options-related attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view CallP Options-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify CallP Options-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: accessSideRoutingNeDeterminedViaSignaling
parameter.description: When set to true, the Network Server examines signaling elements in the SIP request in order to determine whether it should apply access-side or network-side processing. This behavior is necessary when a Routing NE can send both access-side and network-side requests.

parameter.name: disableNdcValidationForCalledNumbers
parameter.description: When set to true, it forces the Network Server to suspend NDC validation for called numbers whenever the Network Server has no defined NDC rules for the called number's country code.

parameter.name: forceRoutingNEProfile
parameter.description: When set to true, upon reception of a SIP request, the Network Server will always try to match a BroadWorks user from the SIP request to route the call.

context.name: PolicyPrecedence
context.description: This level allows the system provider to set the precedence of policies, as well as policy precedence-related attributes. This functionality allows a system provider greater flexibility when designing different routing options and scenarios. A system provider (and only a system provider) can view and edit the processing precedence of all policies defined. Policy precedence is configurable and is defined on a system-wide basis (the order is the same for all subscribers in the system). This feature supports all types of policies: public and enterprise. Originally, to manage policy precedence, the Network Server assigned a real precedence number to each policy, and the policies ran in ascending order of precedence number. These precedence numbers were assigned by BroadSoft. With this feature, a policy now has two real precedence numbers: the Network Server default precedence number and the system provider-assigned custom precedence number. The order in which policies run during a call is controlled by the custom precedence numbers.NOTE: The actual real precedence number is hidden and only the actual relative order is visible. The Network Server supports the following ordering functions:Move policy A before policy B. Move policy C after policy D. Reset the precedence number of a policy to its original default value. (However, the actual new position of the policy relative to the others is undetermined since the order of the other policies may have been changed by previous commands.)Reset the precedence number of all policies to their original default values. In the past, policy precedence numbers were not always the same from one release to another, thereby resulting in behavioral call processing changes because policies were not necessarily running in the same order for every release. This feature ensures that policies run in the same order, unless manual ordering changes are performed. A flag indicates if the precedence number of a policy is no longer the same as the default one provided by BroadSoft. Using this information, a system provider can decide if the policy ordering should be aligned with the one provided by BroadSoft or if it should remain custom. When BroadSoft introduces a new routing policy, it assigns to it a default precedence number. Because policy precedence is now configurable, the position of the new policy relative to the others becomes undetermined. However, in a system that uses the default precedence numbers, the new policy falls in the BroadSoft recommended position. Changing the order of policies takes effect immediately. All subsequent calls have policies run in the new specified order. This feature only ensures that policies run in the desired order. It does not guarantee that the new order is logical or functional. Note that the VTR tool output is enhanced to list policies in order of execution rather than in the alphabetical order.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view policy precedence-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify policy precedence-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Select the policy precedence option: "defaultAll" or "policy".

parameter.name: policy
parameter.description: Selects the policy to be re-ordered.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The anchoring policy.

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: Resets the policy precedence to its default place in the order.

parameter.name: after
parameter.description: Sets the policy precedence to come after the policy "otherName".

parameter.name: otherName
parameter.description: The name of a policy to move.

parameter.name: before
parameter.description: Sets the policy precedence to come before the policy "otherName".

parameter.name: otherName
parameter.description: The name of a policy to move.

context.name: Translation
context.description: This level is used to view and modify translation settings. Translations determine the call type (for example, local or toll) from an originating phone number to a terminating phone number. North American translation information requires the NPA-NXX Active Code List (NNACL) and the Local Calling Area (LCA) screening files used for call type identification. The Network Server supports the uploading of files for translation of calls coming into the Network Server and the routing of calls. A public dialing plan lists the different sequences that can be dialed and associates a result to each entry. Public means that it imitates the dialing plans that currently exist in the PSTN. The Network Server supports many dialing plans per country code. However, there is only one entry dial plan per country code. This means that public calls made in a country all go through the same dialing plan.'''NOTE''': The Network Server supports dial plan jumps that occur when the result of a dial plan entry specifies that a new match should be attempted in another dial plan of the same country. The Network Server is able to process calls when the called party number is expressed as a dialed sequence of digits, such as when a phone call is placed by a user. The Network Server supports one entry dial plan per country for this case. If the Network Server receives the called party number expressed as a global E.164 number, it offers the possibility to route this call through an E.164-based dial plan. This allows dialed digits and E.164 dial plans to remain decoupled.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view translation-related attributes, such as the NNACL and LCA files that are active, loading errors, the directory locations of NNACL and LCA files, as well as the contents of those directories.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to: * Change the directory where NNACL and LCA files can be found. * Load NNACL and LCA files. Make a set of NNACL and LCA files active (in use) through a toggle.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: NNACL
parameter.description: Configured file and directory apply to NNACL..

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: File
parameter.description: Name of the file to use.

parameter.name: Dir
parameter.description: Name of the directory to use.

parameter.name: LCA
parameter.description: Configured file and directory apply to LCA.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: File
parameter.description: Name of the file to use.

parameter.name: Dir
parameter.description: Name of the directory to use.

command.name: SaveLCA
command.description: This command is used to save the LCA file setting specified or changed.

parameter.name: destLata

context.name: Treatment
context.description: This level is used to view and modify treatments. Treatments are the scheme by which Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) error codes are handled. When a specific event occurs, the Network Server returns the corresponding SIP message. Most treatments are predefined and cannot be changed except for the corresponding SIP code and description (system defined). However, this level allows addition, modification, and deletion of treatments that correspond to dial plans (user defined).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view treatment-related attributes, such as the treatment name, corresponding SIP code, SIP message description, and whether the treatment is system or user defined.

parameter.name: SIPcode
parameter.description: The corresponding SIP code.

parameter.name: Q850Value
parameter.description: The value of the associated Q.850 cause.

parameter.name: trapEnabled
parameter.description: If false, a call information SNMP trap is not generated. If true, a call information SNMP trap is generated.

command.description: This command is used to add treatment-related attributes. When adding a new treatment to the system, the treatment name, description, and corresponding SIP code are set. To add a new treatment to the system:

parameter.name: SIPcode

parameter.name: Q850Value

parameter.name: trapEnabled
parameter.description: If false, a call information SNMP trap is not generated. If true, a call information SNMP trap is generated.

parameter.name: treatment

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.name: desc

parameter.name: Q850Value

parameter.description: If false, a call information SNMP trap is not generated. If true, a call information SNMP trap is generated.

parameter.name: treatment
parameter.description: The treatment name.

context.name: Carrier
context.description: This level is used to view and modify carrier settings. The Network Server allows the capturing of a list of all the inter-exchange carriers connected (directly or indirectly) to the current network. It provides a mapping between a unique carrier name and its corresponding carrier access code (CAC). Whether the carrier supports LATAs (Local Access Toll Area) is also defined: intra-LATA (within the same LATA) calls, inter-LATA (between two LATAs) calls, and international calls. Additionally, the Network Elements (NEs) preferred by each carrier via which calls will be routed can be added, viewed, modified, and deleted.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view carrier-related attributes, such as the carrier name, code, and intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international support. Using the command alone displays all records. Using the command with a specific variable displays records matching the criteria specified.

parameter.name: carrier
parameter.description: The name of the carrier.

parameter.name: carrier
parameter.description: The name of the carrier.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The carrier country code.

parameter.name: CAC
parameter.description: The carrier access code.

parameter.name: intraLata
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not intra-LATA toll call routing.

parameter.name: interLata
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not inter-LATA toll call routing.

parameter.name: intl
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not international toll call routing.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add carrier-related attributes. When adding a new carrier to the system, the name, CAC, and intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international support are set.

parameter.name: carrier
parameter.description: The name of the carrier.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.description: The carrier country code.

parameter.name: CAC
parameter.description: The carrier access code.

parameter.name: intraLata
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not intra-LATA toll call routing.

parameter.name: interLata
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not inter-LATA toll call routing.

parameter.name: intl
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not international toll call routing.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify carrier-related attributes, such as the intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international carrier. The carrier name is used to identify the record to be changed.

parameter.name: carrier
parameter.description: The name of the carrier.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: intraLata
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not intra-LATA toll call routing.

parameter.name: interLata
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not inter-LATA toll call routing.

parameter.name: intl
parameter.description: This carrier does support or not international toll call routing.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete carriers. The unique carrier name is used to delete the associated record.

parameter.name: carrier
parameter.description: The name of the carrier.

Using the command alone displays all records. Using the command with a specified variable only displays records matching the specified criteria.

parameter.name: carrier
parameter.description: The name of the carrier.

parameter.name: ne

context.name: ClientSession
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the active web and command line interface sessions for administrators and users.

context.name: InactivityTimer
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the inactivity timers for active web and command line interface sessions. After a designated period of inactivity, for example, users will be automatically logged out of active sessions.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the types of sessions and the length of time they are permitted to remain open without activity.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the inactivity timers for web and CLI sessions.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: active
parameter.description: When set to false, the timer is not set. The default value is used. When set to true, the timer is set. The timeoutInMinutes value is used.

parameter.name: timeoutInMinutes
parameter.description: The length of time that a web or CLI session can be open without any activity. When the limit is reached, the user is automatically logged out. The default value is 10 minutes.

context.name: ConfigAgent
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the BroadWorks Configuration Agent information for the BroadWorks server.

context.name: Device
context.description: This level is used to view and modify devices. The Network Server keeps a list of all addressable devices in the network (for example, Application Servers or softswitches). This is necessary to specify where a call is routed. As well, specific Network Element (NE) routes can be defined and an associated cost and weight assigned to them. Network devices are organized as follows: *Hosting NEs: Network Elements (NEs) used for hosting subscribers in the network. *Monitor: Network Server set to poll Network Elements (NEs). It monitors network devices, specifically to view and set pinging intervals for Network Elements (NEs). *Resources NEs: Network Elements (NEs) that provide specific services, such as a Media Server. *Routing NEs : Network Elements (NEs) (NEs) used to route calls. *Xsp Farm : A set of Xsp hosts integrated into a Xsp Farm whereby each individual Xsp is able to serve web pages for any user hosted on any Application Server in the network. The Network Server is used to locate on which Application Server a user is hosted.

context.name: HostingNE
context.description: This level is used to view and modify a hosting Network Element (NE). A hosting NE is an end-point hosting, or serving, subscribers in the network. For example, an Application Server is a hosting NE. This level is used to view, add, modify, and delete hosting Network Elements (NEs), as well as provide access to functions for hosting Network Element (NE) addresses, lines/ports, media, and nodes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Hosting Network Element (NE)-related attributes, such as the Network Element (NE) name, the corresponding IP address, and default enterprise. Using a specific variable with the command only displays records matching the specified criteria.

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The hosting Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The hosting Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: The name of the profile to be used for this hosting Network Element (NE) in precedence over the system profile.

parameter.name: dfltEnterprise
parameter.description: Used to temporarily map a default enterprise name on the Network Server when user data is uploaded from the Application Server.

parameter.name: dfltRoutingEnterprise
parameter.description: Used to temporarily map a default routing enterprise name on the Network Server when user data is uploaded from the Application Server.

parameter.name: dfltSite
parameter.description: Used to temporarily map a default site on the Network Server when user data is uploaded from the Application Server.

parameter.name: dfltRoutingSite
parameter.description: Used to temporarily map a default routing site on the Network Server when user data is uploaded from the Application Server.

parameter.name: signaling
parameter.description: Signaling option supported by this HostingNe: *E164Compliant: The target device supports E.164 encoded information. *Forking: When enabled, ensures that contacts generated by a policy instance pointing to different addresses on the same Network Element (NE) all receive the same qvalue. This allows receiving end to trigger forking for contacts with same qvalue. *CallTypeInfoRequired: The target device requires the call type information to be sent back as part of the 302 contacts returned by the Network Server. *SourceId: The target device supports Originating Trunk Groups (OTGs), a means of identifying enterprises, user groups, and sites. *SubLocationRoutingBypass: Allows the Subscriber Location policy to bypass call routing for the hosting NE. *ESLCallCategoryOverride: Allows the Enterprise Subscriber Location policy to bypass the hosting NE. *RequiresNetworkIndication: When this option is enabled for the hosting NE, the Network Server responds back as an InterAS, InterHostingNe, or InterNetwork. *NSReasonSupported: When this option is enabled, the Network Server sends back the Reason header with the BW-NS protocol. *RequiresChargeIndication: Indicates whether the charge indicator is returned as part of the contact to the hosting NE. *SIPIPv4NotSupported: Indicates whether this hosting NE supports IPv4 or not. *SIPIPv6NotSupported: Indicates whether this hosting NE supports IPv6 or not.

parameter.name: countryCode
parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.name: poll
parameter.description: If set to "true", allows the Network Server to poll another device such as an Application Server, Media Server, or gateway.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: Sets the state of the device.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Indicates the type of device.

parameter.name: xspVersionEqual
parameter.description: Specifies if this web portal interacting with this HostingNe must be or not at the same BroadWorks version.

parameter.name: clusterType
parameter.description: Specifies the type of cluster and how redundancy is achieved in this cluster.

parameter.name: userCapacityThousands
parameter.description: The maximum number of users that this cluster can support (in thousands of users).

parameter.name: hostingNeCapabilities
parameter.description: Capabilities supported by this HostingNe: *ProvisioningCapable: The Hosting NE can be used to provision the system. *CallProcessingCapable: The Hosting NE can be used to process calls.

parameter.name: signalCicAddedAsCacToAS
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the Network Server sends the Carrier Identification Code (CIC) as Carrier Access Code (CAC) prefix in the user part of a contact returned to the requesting Hosting Network Element(NE). Values include "False" and "True".

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Hosting Network Element (NE) including the NE name, profile, default enterprise, signaling, and country code.

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: Profile to be used for this hosting Network Element (NE) having precedence over the system profile.

parameter.name: dfltEnterprise
parameter.description: Used to temporarily map a default enterprise name on the Network Server when user data is uploaded from the Application Server.

parameter.name: dfltRoutingEnterprise
parameter.description: Used to temporarily map a default routing enterprise name on the Network Server when user data is uploaded from the Application Server.

parameter.name: dfltSite
parameter.description: Used to temporarily map a default site on the Network Server when user data is uploaded from the Application Server.

parameter.name: dfltRoutingSite
parameter.description: Used to temporarily map a default routing site on the Network Server when user data is uploaded from the Application Server.

parameter.description: The country code.

parameter.description: Allows the Network Server to poll another device such as an Application Server, Media Server, or Gateway.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: Sets the state of the device.

parameter.description: Specifies if this web portal interacting with this HostingNe must be or not at the same BroadWorks version.

parameter.name: clusterType
parameter.description: Specifies the type of cluster and how redundancy is achieved in this cluster.

parameter.name: userCapacityThousands
parameter.description: The maximum number of users that this cluster can support (in thousands of users).

parameter.description: Capabilities supported by this HostingNe: *ProvisioningCapable: The Hosting NE can be used to provision the system. *CallProcessingCapable: The Hosting NE can be used to process calls.

This allows receiving end to trigger forking for contacts with same qvalue. *CallTypeInfoRequired: The target device requires the call type information to be sent back as part of the 302 contacts returned by the Network Server. *SourceId: The target device supports Originating Trunk Groups (OTGs), a means of identifying enterprises, user groups, and sites. *SubLocationRoutingBypass: Allows the Subscriber Location policy to bypass call routing for the hosting NE. *ESLCallCategoryOverride: Allows the Enterprise Subscriber Location policy to bypass the hosting NE. *RequiresNetworkIndication: When this option is enabled for the hosting NE, the Network Server responds back as an InterAS, InterHostingNe, or InterNetwork. *NSReasonSupported: When this option is enabled, the Network Server sends back the Reason header with the BW-NS protocol. *RequiresChargeIndication: Indicates whether the charge indicator is returned as part of the contact to the hosting NE. *SIPIPv4NotSupported: Indicates whether this hosting NE supports IPv4 or not. *SIPIPv6NotSupported: Indicates whether this hosting NE supports IPv6 or not.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Indicates the type of device.

parameter.name: signalCicAddedAsCacToAS
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the Network Server sends the Carrier Identification Code (CIC) as Carrier Access Code (CAC) prefix in the user part of a contact returned to the requesting Hosting Network Element(NE). Values include "False" and "True".

parameter.name: attribute

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete Network Elements (NEs) (NEs). The unique Network Element (NE) name is used to identify the record to be deleted.

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE) to be deleted.

context.name: Address
context.description: This level is used to display, add, modify, and delete hosting Network Element (NE) addresses.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view hosting Network Element (NE) address-related attributes, such as the Network Element (NE) node ID, address, type, cost, weight, and port. Using the command with a parameter only displays records matching the specified criteria.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Cluster member ID.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The IP address, or host name, or domain name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of interface: *Signaling: The address is a SIP signaling address. It can be added to the contact list from a returned 302 following a SIP request. *Access: The address is a public address. It is returned when requesting a Hosting NE address through the Location API. It is not returned for SIP requests. *DualRouting: This address is public and also a SIP signaling address at the same time. It will be returned for SIP and location API requests. *Alias: An alias can be used to identify a hosting NE. It is never returned in a contact list. An alias is used for the Sync API. The host name for the Application Server synchronizing with the Network Server should have an alias defined. An alias is also used for incoming call requests. The address is validated and can send requests to the Network Server.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the Network Element (NE) with 1 being the lowest and 9 being the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, Network Elements (NEs) will be randomly listed according to weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number.

parameter.name: transport
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the preferred transport protocol for routing, resource, and hosting Network Elements (NEs) on the Network Server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add hosting Network Element (NE) address-related attributes.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Cluster member ID. Default is 0.For non-redundant hosting NEs, nodeID is set to 0; then addresses are assigned to it.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The corresponding IP address, or host name, or domain name for the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of interface.

parameter.name: DualRouting
parameter.description: This address is public and also a SIP signaling address at the same time. It will be returned for SIP and location API requests.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, Network Elements (NEs) will be randomly listed according to weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number.

parameter.name: transport
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the preferred transport for routing, resource, and hosting Network Elements (NEs) on the Network Server.
