parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE) node.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Cluster member ID.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The corresponding IP address, or host name, or domain name for the Network Element (NE).

context.name: LinePort
context.description: This level is used to delete hosting Network Element (NE) line/ports.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete all lines/ports associated with a hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE) node for which all lines/ports are to be deleted.

context.name: Media
context.description: This level is used to enable or disable codec-based routing on the hosting Network Element (NE). You can also view, add, remove, or modify mediaCodecs assigned to the hosting Network Element (NE).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view mediaCodecs currently assigned to the hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: codecBasedRtg
parameter.description: Specifies if codec-based routing is enabled or disabled on this Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: mediaCodec
parameter.description: Indicates the name of the mediaCodec associated with the hosting Network Element (NE).

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to assign mediaCodecs to a hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: mediaCodec
parameter.description: The name of the mediaCodec associated with the Network Element (NE) specified by the hostNe attribute.

parameter.name: codecBasedRtg
parameter.description: Specifies if codec-based routing is enabled on this Network Element (NE).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify mediaCodecs assigned to hosting Network Elements (NEs).

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: codecBasedRtg
parameter.description: Specifies if codec-based routing is enabled or disabled on this Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: mediaCodec
parameter.description: The name of the mediaCodec associated with the Network Element (NE) specified by the hostNe attribute.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete mediaCodecs assigned to hosting Network Elements (NEs).

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: mediaCodec
parameter.description: Indicates the name of the mediaCodec associated with the Network Element (NE) specified by the hostNe attribute.

parameter.name: codecBasedRtg
parameter.description: Specifies if codec-based routing is enabled or disabled on this Network Element (NE).

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the attributes of mediaCodecs assigned to hosting Network Elements (NEs).

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: Codec
context.description: This level is used to view or modify the priority attribute for a Codec associated to a Hosting Network Element (NE).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Hosting Network Element (NE) Codec-related attributes. The Hosting NE name is used to identify the record.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to use as a filter.

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the Hosting Network Element (NE).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Hosting Network Element (NE) Codec-related attributes, such as the priority. The Hosting NE name is used to identify the record to change.

parameter.name: hostNe
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Hosting Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: codec
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the codec.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the associated priority code for the Network Element (NE). The value "1" is the highest priority while "99" is the lowest.

context.name: Node
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the node settings. The Network Server supports hosting NEs deployed in a redundant or clustered configuration. A redundant Application Server configuration can have multiple servers (a cluster) all hosting the same users. However users are active on only one Application Server. To support this redundant server configuration, all servers in a cluster are configured under a single hosting NE with each server having a different node ID. Each hosting NE and node ID combination can have addresses set.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view hosting Network Element (NE) node-related attributes, such as the Network Element (NE) name, node ID and description.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: The cluster member ID. The default is 0. For non-redundant hosting NEs, nodeID is set to 0; then addresses are assigned to it.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: If false, this node is not the default. If true, this node is the default.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: The node's version. This attribute is initialized to "unknown". It is updated the next time the node attempts to connect to the Network Server through the location API.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: A description of the Network Element (NE) node.

parameter.name: loadBalancingWeight
parameter.description: Weight (importance) of the node when part of a load-balancing cluster.

parameter.name: dataCenterId
parameter.description: The data center id of the node when it is part of a data center.

command.name: detail
command.description: This command is used to view hosting Network Element (NE) nodes detail attributes.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Cluster member ID. Default is 0.For non-redundant hosting NEs, nodeID is set to 0; then addresses are assigned to it.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add hosting Network Element (NE) node-related attributes.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Cluster member ID. Default is 0.For non-redundant hosting NEs, nodeID is set to 0; then addresses are assigned to it.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: If false, this node is not the default. If true, this node is the default.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: The node's version. This attribute is initialized to "unknown". The fields will be updated the next time the node attempts to connect to the Network Server through the location API.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: The node's description or purpose.

parameter.name: patchLevel
parameter.description: The node's patch level. This attribute is kept for backwards compatibility, valid but ignored in Release 14 and higher. It will be removed in Release 17.

parameter.name: minimumWebPatchLevel
parameter.description: The node's minimum web-patch level. This attribute is kept for backwards compatibility, valid but ignored in Release 14 and higher. It will be removed in Release 17.

parameter.name: webImpactingPatches
parameter.description: The list of patches EV numbers that the Web Portal must have to serve pages for the target Application Server (for example, [empty], or "34872-39610").

parameter.name: loadBalancingWeight
parameter.description: Weight (importance) of the node when part of a load-balancing cluster.

parameter.name: dataCenterId
parameter.description: The data center id of the node when it is part of a data center.

parameter.name: NEMaintenancePartitionName
parameter.description: The name of the NE Maintenance Partition associated to this node.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify hosting Network Element (NE) node-related attributes.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Cluster member ID. Default is 0.For non-redundant hosting NEs, nodeID is set to 0; then addresses are assigned to it.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: If false, this node is not the default. If true, this node is the default.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: The nodes version. This attribute is initialized to "unknown". The fields will be updated the next time the node attempts to connect to the Network Server through the location API.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: A description of the hosting Network Element (NE) node.

parameter.name: patchLevel
parameter.description: The nodes patch level. This attribute is kept for backwards compatibility, valid but ignored in releases 14 and higher. It will be removed in release 17.

parameter.name: minimumWebPatchLevel
parameter.description: The node's minimum patch level. This attribute is kept for backwards compatibility, valid but ignored in releases 14 and higher. It will be removed in release 17.

parameter.name: webImpactingPatches
parameter.description: The list of patches EV numbers that the Web Portal must have to serve pages for the target Application Server (for example, [empty], or "34872-39610").

parameter.name: loadBalancingWeight
parameter.description: Weight (importance) of the node when part of a load-balancing cluster.

parameter.name: dataCenterId
parameter.description: The data center id of the node when it is part of a data center.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete hosting Network Element (NE) node-related attributes.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE) node.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Cluster member ID.

context.name: HostingNESet
context.description: This level is used to add, view, modify and delete hosting Network Element (NE) sets. This is a group of Application Server cluster (Hosting NE).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the hosting Network Element (NE) sets.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a hosting Network Element (NE) set. If the set to be added should also become the system set, indicated with attribute systemSet set to true, then the set currently flagged as being the system set (if any) will no longer be the selected system set.

parameter.name: hostingNESetName
parameter.description: This is the name of the hosting NE set.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to add.

parameter.name: systemSet
parameter.description: True is the Hosting NE set is also the system set, false otherwise.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a hosting Network Element (NE) set. If the set to be modified should become the system set, indicated with attribute systemSet set to true, then the set currently flagged as being the system set (if any) will no longer be the selected system set.

parameter.name: hostingNESetName
parameter.description: This is the name of the hosting NE set.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: systemSet
parameter.description: True is the Hosting NE set is also the system set, false otherwise.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a hosting Network Element (NE) set. If the set to be deleted is flagged as being the system set, the CLI waits for a confirmation from the user before deleting the set.

parameter.name: hostingNESetName
parameter.description: This is the name of the hosting NE set.

context.name: HostingNEs
context.description: This level is used to add, get, delete and modify hosting Network Element (NE) associations to Hosting NE Sets.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the hosting Network Elements (NEs) (NEs) that are part of a Hosting NE set.

parameter.name: hostingNESetName
parameter.description: This is the name of the hosting NE set.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a hosting Network Element (NE) to a hosting NE set.

parameter.name: hostingNESetName
parameter.description: This is the name of the hosting NE set.

parameter.name: hostingNE
parameter.description: Name of the Hosting NE to be added to the hosting NE set.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a hosting Network Element (NE) from a hosting NE set.

parameter.name: hostingNESetName
parameter.description: This is the name of the hosting NE set.

parameter.name: hostingNE
parameter.description: Name of the Hosting NE to be deleted from the Hosting NE set.

context.name: Media
context.description: This level is used to view and modify media settings. To easily maintain all types of codecs and media types together, the Network Server defines the concept of mediaCodec. A mediaCodec is a unique name in the system that either defines a specific codec (MIME subtype) or a whole media type (MIME type). To define mediaCodecs in the system, the system administrator can create and maintain a list of mediaCodecs that then can define both media types and codecs. This level is used to view, add, delete, or modify media types (MIME types).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the media types currently stored.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add new media types. The name and mediaType attributes should be unique against other entries at this level.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a whole media type (MIME type).

parameter.name: mediaType
parameter.description: The corresponding media type name used in SIP messages. It is either a media type or MIME type.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: The description of the media type.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the associated priority code of the codec. The value "1" is the highest priority while "99" is the lowest.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify media type-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a whole media type (MIME type).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: mediaType
parameter.description: The corresponding media type name used in SIP messages. It is either a media type or MIME type.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: The description of the media type.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the associated priority code of the codec. The value "1" is the highest priority while "99" is the lowest.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete existing media types.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a whole media type (MIME type).

context.name: Codec
context.description: This level is used to view and modify codecs. To easily maintain all types of codecs and media types together, the Network Server defines the concept of mediaCodec. A mediaCodec is a unique name in the system that either defines a specific Codec (MIME subtype) or a whole media type (MIME type). In order to define mediaCodecs in the system, the system administrator can create and maintain a list of mediaCodecs that then can define both media types and codecs. This level is used to view, add, delete, modify, or clear specific codecs (MIME subtypes).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the codecs currently stored.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new codec.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the codec.

parameter.name: encodingName
parameter.description: Specifies the codec name used in SIP messages.

parameter.name: mediaType
parameter.description: Specifies the media type to which the codec (MIME subtype) belongs.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: payloadType
parameter.description: Indicates the RTP AVP payload type ID number.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: The description of the codec.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the associated priority code of the codec. The value "1" is the highest priority while "99" is the lowest.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify codec-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the codec.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: encodingName
parameter.description: Specifies the codec name used in SIP messages.

parameter.name: mediaType
parameter.description: Specifies the list of media types to which the codec (MIME subtype) belongs.

parameter.name: payloadType
parameter.description: Indicates the RTP AVP payload type ID number.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: The description of the codec.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the associated priority code of the codec. The value "1" is the highest priority while "99" is the lowest.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete existing codecs.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the codec.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear existing codec-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the codec.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute(s) to clear.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify general settings for codec based routing. It is used to enable or disable the reordering of route entries based on the preference of signaled codecs that are offered in the Session Description Protocol (SDP).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the general settings of Codec.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the general settings of Codec.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enableRoutingOnCodecPreference
parameter.description: This parameter controls wether the route entries are reorderd by the preference of the signaled codecs that are offered in the SDP.

context.name: Monitor
context.description: This level is used to set the Network Server to poll Network Elements (NEs). It is used to monitor network devices, specifically to view and set pinging intervals for Network Elements (NEs).

context.name: NetworkDevice
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the pinging intervals for monitored Network Elements (NEs).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the pinging intervals of monitored Network Elements (NEs)-related attributes. When the pollingIntervalInMin is set to 0, the Network Server will stop polling Network Elements (NEs). Any other value indicates that polling is enabled.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the pinging intervals for a network device.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: pollingIntervalInMin
parameter.description: Set pollingIntervalInMin to 0 to stop the Network Server from polling Network Elements (NEs).

parameter.name: failedPollingIntervalInMin
parameter.description: Indicates the time (in minutes) that must pass before the polling is considered "failed".

context.name: NEMaintenancePartition
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify and delete a Network Element (NE) maintenance partition. The NE maintenance partition groups NEs together that are meant to work together as a sub-network of the entire network. As a result, the NEs in a NE maintenance partition should be BroadWorks-compatible with each other. Each NE is part of one NE maintenance partition at a time.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Network Element (NE) maintenance partitions.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of an existing Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Network Element (NE) maintenance partition. If this is the first NE maintenance partition, it automatically becomes the system partition. Otherwise, the previous system partition remains.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the NE Maintenance Partition to be created.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the attributes of a Network Element (NE) maintenance partition. If the systemPartition attribute is set, this partition becomes the new system NE maintenance partition and the NE maintenance partition previously flagged as the system partition is no longer selected as the system partition.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the NE Maintenance Partition to modify.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: systemPartition
parameter.description: Indicates whether this is to become the new system partition.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of an existing NE Maintenance Partition.

context.name: HostingNENodes
context.description: This level is used to add, get, and delete the hosting Network Element (NE) node associations to NE maintenance partitions.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the hosting Network Element (NE) nodes that are part of a NE maintenance partition.

parameter.name: NEMaintenancePartitionName
parameter.description: The name of the NE Maintenance Partition.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a hosting Network Element (NE) node to a NE maintenance partition.

parameter.name: NEMaintenancePartitionName
parameter.description: The name of the NE Maintenance Partition.

parameter.name: hostingNE
parameter.description: The name of the hosting NE which includes the node to be added to the NE Maintenance Partition.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: The hosting NE node ID to be added to the NE Maintenance Partition.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a hosting Network Element (NE) from a NE maintenance partition.

parameter.name: NEMaintenancePartitionName
parameter.description: The name of the NE Maintenance Partition.

parameter.name: hostingNE
parameter.description: The name of the hosting NE which includes the node to be removed from the NE Maintenance Partition.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: The hosting NE node ID to be removed from the NE Maintenance Partition.

context.name: XSPServerFarmNodes
context.description: This level is used to add, get, and delete an Xtended Services Platform farm node associations to Network Element (NE) maintenance partitions.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Xtended Services Platform farm nodes that are part of a Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

parameter.name: NEMaintenancePartitionName
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an Xtended Services Platform farm node to a Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

parameter.name: NEMaintenancePartitionName
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

parameter.name: XSPFarmName
parameter.description: The name of the Xtended Services Platform farm which includes the node to be added to the NE maintenance partition.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: The Xtended Services Platform farm node ID to be added to the Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an Xtended Services Platform farm node from a Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

parameter.name: NEMaintenancePartitionName
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

parameter.name: XSPFarmName
parameter.description: The name of the Xtended Services Platform farm which includes the node to be removed from the Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: The Xtended Services Platform farm node ID to be removed from the Network Element (NE) maintenance partition.

context.name: ResourceNE
context.description: This level is used to display, add, modify, and delete the resource Network Elements (NEs), including the functions for addressing and the Media Server selection for those elements. The BroadWorks Media Server provides specialized media resources, interactive voice response, and conferencing capabilities. The Network Server keeps a list of all the addressable Media Servers in the network. Media Servers are assigned an associated cost and weight that determines the order in which they are listed for use. Cost and weight are only used if the Media Server is the default Media Server. As well, Media Servers and NEs are associated so when a request from an Application Server is made, the nearest Media Server to the NE for the user's phone number is used. The relationship between Media Servers and NEs is many-to-many.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the resource Network Element (NE) attributes including the name, type, location, cost, weight, default status, and state.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: neType
parameter.description: The type of element.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: The physical location of the resource Network Element (NE) in the network. For North America, set to 1-NPANXX.For other countries, include the country code corresponding to the country where the element is located.

parameter.name: staticWeight
parameter.description: The static weight for the resource Network Element (NE) used in the post-processing for a V&H lookup.

parameter.name: staticCost
parameter.description: The static cost code for the resource Network Element (NE) used in the post-processing for a V&H lookup. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest. Given the same cost, resource Network Elements (NEs) will be randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: poll
parameter.description: Allows the Network Server to poll another device such as an Application Server, Media Server, or gateway.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: The state of the resource Network Element (NE): *OffLine: The resource Network Element (NE) is off line and not available to the Network Server. *OnLine: The resource Network Element (NE) is on line and is available to the Network Server.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: If "false", do not use as a default resource Network Element (NE). If "true", this resource Network Element (NE) to the pool of elements to be used when there is no assigned element.

parameter.name: defaultCost
parameter.description: The default cost used in the post-processing of the default resource Network Element (NE) list.

parameter.name: defaultWeight
parameter.description: The default weight used in the post-processing of the default resource Network Element (NE) list.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services: *annc: Network announcement service. *cfw-conf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of up to 49 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-largeconf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of at least 50 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-ivr: Indicates a media server port optimized for basic IVR operations, such as msc-ivr and VoiceXML, excluding speech recognition and text-to-speech services. *cfw-media: Indicates a generic media server port that can be used for all services offered through the Cr reference point. This service uses the most resources on the Media Server and should only be used for services such as Call Center coaching, speech recognition, or text-to-speech. *conf: Conference service. *dialog: Prompt and Collect service also known as Voice Dialog service. *fax: Fax service. *ivr: Interactive voice response service. *liveAudio: Live audio source service. *repeater: Repeater service.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a resource Network Element (NE) to the system including the name, type, location, and state. If the resource Network Element (NE) is to be added to the pool of default element, the associated cost and weight are also set. Static cost and weight values are used when the Media Server Selection policy needs to sort results obtained from the V&H (geographic) engine. Elements with the same location are sorted by cost and weight (lowest cost first and weighted shuffling for identical costs).

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: neType
parameter.description: The type of the resource Network Element (NE): *SIMPLE: The device is a SIMPLE-based messaging server. *ms: The device is a media server. *uvs: The device is a unified video server. Service "cfw-collab" will be assigned by default for uvs resource Network Element (NE)

parameter.name: ms
parameter.description: The ResourceNE is of type Media Server, thus requires additional configuration attribute(s).

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services: *annc: Network announcement service. *cfw-conf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of up to 49 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-largeconf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of at least 50 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-ivr: Indicates a media server port optimized for basic IVR operations, such as msc-ivr and VoiceXML, excluding speech recognition and text-to-speech services. *cfw-media: Indicates a generic media server port that can be used for all services offered through the Cr reference point. This service uses the most resources on the Media Server and should only be used for services such as Call Center coaching, speech recognition, or text-to-speech. *conf: Conference service. *dialog: Prompt and Collect service also known as Voice Dialog service. *fax: Fax service. *ivr: Interactive voice response service. *liveAudio: Live audio source service. *repeater: Repeater service.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: The physical location of the resource Network Element (NE) in the network. For North America, set to 1-NPANXX.For other countries, include the country code corresponding to the country where the resource Network Element (NE) is located.

parameter.name: staticCost
parameter.description: The static cost for the resource Network Element (NE) used in the post-processing for a V&H lookup. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest. Given the same cost, resource Network Elements (NEs) will be randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: staticWeight
parameter.description: The static weight for the resource Network Element (NE) used in the post-processing for a V&H lookup.

parameter.name: poll
parameter.description: Allows the Network Server to poll another device such as an Application Server, Media Server, or Gateway.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: The state of the resource Network Element (NE): *OffLine: The resource Network Element (NE) is off line and not available to the Network Server. *OnLine: The resource Network Element (NE) is on line and is available to the Network Server.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: The default cost used in the post-processing of the default resource Network Element (NE) list.

parameter.name: defaultCost
parameter.description: The default cost used in the post-processing of the default resource Network Element (NE) list.

parameter.name: defaultWeight
parameter.description: The default weight used in the post-processing of the default resource Network Element (NE) list.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the resource Network Element (NE) attributes including the location, default status, and state. The default resource Network Element (NE) can also be set. When setting a default resource Network Element (NE), the associated cost and weight are also specified. Static cost and weight values are used when the Media Server Selection policy needs to sort results obtained from the V&H (geographic) engine. Resource Network Elements (NEs) with the same location are sorted by cost and weight (lowest cost first and weighted shuffling for identical costs). The resource Network Element (NE) name is used to identify the record to be changed.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: The physical location of the resource Network Element (NE) in the network. For North America, set to 1-NPANXX.For other countries, include the country code corresponding to the country where the resource Network Element (NE) is located.

parameter.name: staticCost
parameter.description: The static cost for the resource Network Element (NE) used in the post-processing for a V&H lookup. 1 is the lowest cost and 9 the highest. Given the same cost, resource Network Elements (NEs) are randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: staticWeight
parameter.description: The static weight for the resource Network Element (NE) used in the post-processing for a V&H lookup.

parameter.name: poll
parameter.description: Allows the Network Server to poll another device such as an Application Server, Media Server, or Gateway.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: The state of the resource Network Element (NE): *OffLine: The resource Network Element (NE) is off line and not available to the Network Server. *OnLine: The resource Network Element (NE) is on line and is available to the Network Server.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: If "false", do not use as a default resource Network Element (NE). If "true", this resource Network Element (NE) to the pool of elements to be used when there is no assigned element.

parameter.name: defaultCost
parameter.description: The default cost used in the post-processing of the default resource Network Element (NE) list.

parameter.name: defaultWeight
parameter.description: The default weight used in the post-processing of the default resource Network Element (NE) list.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services: *annc: Network announcement service. *cfw-conf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of up to 49 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-largeconf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of at least 50 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-ivr: Indicates a media server port optimized for basic IVR operations, such as msc-ivr and VoiceXML, excluding speech recognition and text-to-speech services. *cfw-media: Indicates a generic media server port that can be used for all services offered through the Cr reference point. This service uses the most resources on the Media Server and should only be used for services such as Call Center coaching, speech recognition, or text-to-speech. *conf: Conference service. *dialog: Prompt and Collect service also known as Voice Dialog service. *fax: Fax service. *ivr: Interactive voice response service. *liveAudio: Live audio source service. *repeater: Repeater service.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) name.

context.name: Address
context.description: This level is used to display, add, modify, and delete the addresses associated with resource Network Elements (NEs).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the resource Network Element (NE) attributes, including the address, cost, weight, and port.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The corresponding IP address, or host name, or domain for the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the resource Network Element (NE). 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, resource Network Elements (NEs) are randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) port number.

parameter.name: transport
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the preferred transport for routing, resource, and hosting Network Elements (NEs) on the Network Server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a resource Network Element (NE) address to the system including the name, address, cost, weight, and port.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The corresponding IP address, or host name, or domain for the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the resource Network Element (NE). 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, resource Network Elements (NEs) are randomly listed according to weight with higher weights appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) port number.

parameter.name: transport
parameter.description: Specifies the preferred transport for routing, resource, and hosting Network Elements (NEs) on the Network Server.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the resource Network Element (NE) address-related attributes including the cost, weight, and port.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The corresponding IP address, or host name, or domain for the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the resource Network Element (NE). 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, resource Network Elements (NEs) are randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) port number.

parameter.name: transport
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the preferred transport for routing, resource, and hosting Network Elements (NEs) on the Network Server.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete the resource Network Element (NE) addresses.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The corresponding IP address, or host name, or domain for the resource Network Element (NE).

context.name: MSSelect
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Media Server Network Element (NE) settings. Media Servers are resource Network Element (NE)s.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Media Server Network Element (NE) entry-related attributes such as the Media Server name and the corresponding Network Element (NE), cost, and weight. Using the command with a specified variable only displays records matching that criteria specified.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of a Network Element (NE) to filter on.

parameter.name: resourceNE
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: routingNE
parameter.description: The name of the routing Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the Media Server. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, Media Servers will be randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: resourceNE
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: routingNE
parameter.description: The name of the routing Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services: *annc: Network announcement service. *cfw-conf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of up to 49 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-largeconf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of at least 50 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-ivr: Indicates a media server port optimized for basic IVR operations, such as msc-ivr and VoiceXML, excluding speech recognition and text-to-speech services. *cfw-media: Indicates a generic media server port that can be used for all services offered through the Cr reference point. This service uses the most resources on the Media Server and should only be used for services such as Call Center coaching, speech recognition, or text-to-speech. *conf: Conference service. *dialog: Prompt and Collect service also known as Voice Dialog service. *fax: Fax service. *ivr: Interactive voice response service. *liveAudio: Live audio source service. *repeater: Repeater service.

parameter.name: neType
parameter.description: The type of the resource Network Element (NE).

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Media Server Network Element (NE) entry including the Media Server name and the corresponding Network Element (NE), cost, and weight.

parameter.name: resourceNE
parameter.description: The resource Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: routingNE
parameter.description: The name of the routing Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services: *annc: Network announcement service. *cfw-conf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of up to 49 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-largeconf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of at least 50 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-ivr: Indicates a media server port optimized for basic IVR operations, such as msc-ivr and VoiceXML, excluding speech recognition and text-to-speech services. *cfw-media: Indicates a generic media server port that can be used for all services offered through the Cr reference point. This service uses the most resources on the Media Server and should only be used for services such as Call Center coaching, speech recognition, or text-to-speech. *conf: Conference service. *dialog: Prompt and Collect service also known as Voice Dialog service. *fax: Fax service. *ivr: Interactive voice response service. *liveAudio: Live audio source service. *repeater: Repeater service. This is required for ms resource Network Element (NE) but not required for uvs resource Network Element (NE). Service "cfw-collab" is assigned by default for uvs resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the Media Server. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, Media Servers is randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Media Server Network Element (NE) entry-related attributes, such as the corresponding cost and weight. The Media Server name/NE combination is used to identify the record to change.

parameter.name: resourceNE
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: routingNE
parameter.description: The name of the routing Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services: *annc: Network announcement service. *cfw-conf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of up to 49 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-largeconf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of at least 50 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-ivr: Indicates a media server port optimized for basic IVR operations, such as msc-ivr and VoiceXML, excluding speech recognition and text-to-speech services. *cfw-media: Indicates a generic media server port that can be used for all services offered through the Cr reference point. This service uses the most resources on the Media Server and should only be used for services such as Call Center coaching, speech recognition, or text-to-speech. *conf: Conference service. *dialog: Prompt and Collect service also known as Voice Dialog service. *fax: Fax service. *ivr: Interactive voice response service. *liveAudio: Live audio source service. *repeater: Repeater service. This is required for ms resource Network Element (NE) but not required for uvs resource Network Element (NE). Service "cfw-collab" is assigned by default for uvs resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the Media Server. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, Media Servers will be randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete Media Server Network Elements (NEs).

parameter.name: resourceNE
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: routingNE
parameter.description: The name of the routing Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services: *annc: Network announcement service. *cfw-conf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of up to 49 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-largeconf: Indicates a media server port optimized for a conference of at least 50 participants using the Cr reference point for control. *cfw-ivr: Indicates a media server port optimized for basic IVR operations, such as msc-ivr and VoiceXML, excluding speech recognition and text-to-speech services. *cfw-media: Indicates a generic media server port that can be used for all services offered through the Cr reference point. This service uses the most resources on the Media Server and should only be used for services such as Call Center coaching, speech recognition, or text-to-speech. *conf: Conference service. *dialog: Prompt and Collect service also known as Voice Dialog service. *fax: Fax service. *ivr: Interactive voice response service. *liveAudio: Live audio source service. *repeater: Repeater service. This is required for ms resource Network Element (NE) but not required for uvs resource Network Element (NE). Service "cfw-collab" is assigned by default for uvs resource Network Element (NE).

context.name: Media
context.description: This level is used to enable or disable codec-based routing on the resource Network Element (NE). You can also view, add, remove, or modify mediaCodecs assigned to the resource Network Element (NE).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view mediaCodecs currently assigned to the resource Network Element (NE).

context.name: RoutingNE
context.description: This level is used to view and modify routing Network Elements (NEs). Routing NEs are end-points in the network that can be used to route calls to so that these calls can be further processed. Routing cost and weight is used to find the routing NE, which is the best choice to receive the call. For example, a network gateway is a routing NE. This level allows display, addition, modification, and deletion of routing Network Elements (NEs), as well as access to functions for addressing and routing for those elements.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view routing Network Element (NE)-related attributes, such as the Network Element (NE) name, location, and the routing profile to be used for this Network Element (NE). A static cost and weight is requested at the Routing NE level. These values are used to sort results obtained from the V&H (geographic) engine. Routing NEs with the same location are sorted by cost and weight (lowest cost first and weighted shuffling for identical costs). Routing profiles defined for routing NEs take precedence over the system routing profile. When you use this command with a specified variable it only displays records matching the criteria specified.

parameter.name: ne
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: ne
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: The physical location of the Network Element (NE) in the network. For North America, set to 1-NPANXX.For other countries, include the country code corresponding to the country where the server is located. "NOTE": An Application Server should have a location = "" while a network gateway should have a location = 1NPANXX.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the Network Element (NE). 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, Network Elements (NEs) will be randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: Profile to be used for this routing Network Element (NE), which has precedence over the system profile.

parameter.name: poll
parameter.description: Allows the Network Server to poll another device such as an Application Server, Media Server, or gateway.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: The state of the NE: *OffLine: The NE is off line and not available to the Network Server. *OnLine: The NE is on line and is available to the Network Server.

parameter.name: signaling
parameter.description: Signaling option supported by this NE: *E164Compliant: The target device supports E.164 encoded information. *Forking: Target device supports forking. Signaling option that ensures contacts generated by a policy instance pointing to different addresses on the same Network Element (NE) all receive the same qvalue. This allows receiving end to trigger forking for contacts with same qvalue. *InboundOnly: Target device is not expecting the Network Server to sends back traffic to it. The device is only used for sending calls in the inbound directory. *UseOrigBasedScreening: Use the call category from call screening (Caller to Called number) instead of the call category from the RoutingNE to the called number. *DisableDynamicRouting: This signaling option allows for the disabling of dynamic routing for the routing NE independently of all other attributes. *AccessRoutingNE: This signaling option specifies whether a routing NE is an access routing NE, that is, the server access device is located on the access-side of the network. *CallTriggerRequired: When the Network Server returns a contact to a gateway that does not support called party numbers encoded in an E.164 format (prefixed with +), it may reformat the called party number in a dialed-digits format, prefixing the called number with the prefix obtained from the call screening result between the location of the gateway and the called party number. *SIPIPv4NotSupported: Indicates whether this routing NE supports IPv4 or not. *SIPIPv6NotSupported: Indicates whether this routing NE supports IPv6 or not.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a routing Network Element (NE). The following attributes are set: Network Element (NE) name, location, and routing profile to be used for this Network Element (NE).Routing profiles defined for routing Network Elements (NEs) take precedence over the system routing profile. The routing profile to be used for this Network Element (NE) must also exist. A static cost and weight is requested at the Routing NE level. These values are used to sort results obtained from the V&H (geographic) engine. Routing NEs with the same location are sorted by cost and weight (lowest cost first and weighted shuffling for identical costs).

parameter.name: ne
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: The physical location of the Network Element (NE) in the network. For North America, set to 1-NPANXX.For other countries, include the country code corresponding to the country where the server is located.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the Network Element (NE). 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: Given the same cost, Network Elements (NEs) will be randomly listed according to the weight with a higher weight appearing more often at the top.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: Profile to be used for this routing Network Element (NE) having precedence over the system profile.

parameter.name: poll

Signaling option that ensures contacts generated by a policy instance pointing to different addresses on the same Network Element (NE) all receive the same qvalue. This allows receiving end to trigger forking for contacts with same qvalue. *InboundOnly: Target device is not expecting the Network Server to sends back traffic to it. The device is only used for sending calls in the inbound directory. *UseOrigBasedScreening: Use the call category from call screening (Caller to Called number) instead of the call category from the RoutingNE to the called number. *DisableDynamicRouting: This signaling option allows for the disabling of dynamic routing for the routing NE independently of all other attributes. *AccessRoutingNE: This signaling option specifies whether a routing NE is an access routing NE, that is, the server access device is located on the access-side of the network. *CallTriggerRequired: When the Network Server returns a contact to a gateway that does not support called party numbers encoded in an E.164 format (prefixed with +), it may reformat the called party number in a dialed-digits format, prefixing the called number with the prefix obtained from the call screening result between the location of the gateway and the called party number. *SIPIPv4NotSupported: Indicates whether this routing NE supports IPv4 or not. *SIPIPv6NotSupported: Indicates whether this routing NE supports IPv6 or not.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify routing Network Element (NE)-related attributes, such as the location and the routing profile to be used for this Network Element (NE). The Network Element (NE) name is used to identify the record to be changed. Routing profiles defined for routing Network Elements (NEs) take precedence over the system routing profile. The routing profile to be used for this Network Element (NE) must also exist. A static cost and weight is requested at the Routing NE level. These values are used to sort results obtained from the V&H (geographic) engine. Routing NEs with the same location are sorted by cost and weight (lowest cost first and weighted shuffling for identical costs).

context.name: Routing
context.description: This level is used to display, add, modify, and delete the routing Network Element (NE) settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Network Element (NE) route-related attributes, such as the corresponding phone numbers and the associated cost and weight. Use this command alone to display all records. Use this command with a specified variable to display records matching the criteria specified. Directory Numbers (DNs) are displayed as a range. For example, a "from" phone number of 151400 and a "to" phone number of 151400 represent all phone numbers starting with 151400 (between 1514000 0000 and 1514009 9999).

parameter.name: ne
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: ne
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting phone number of the range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending phone number of the range.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the phone number range. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: The relative value (user defined) to randomize distribution of traffic along this route.

parameter.name: farendCategory
parameter.description: This allows a route to be flagged as local. This information is used by the network server to determine if the contact to be returned requires a CIC parameter. This field is only used by the FarEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: farendDMI
parameter.description: The digit manipulation index allowing digit manipulation on the routing entry. This field is only used by the FarEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: nearendDMI
parameter.description: The digit manipulation index allowing digit manipulation on the routing entry. This field is only used by the NearEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: nearendDTG
parameter.description: The Destination Trunk Group (DTG) information to be returned in the Contact header when the originator is used to make the routing decision.

parameter.name: farendDTG
parameter.description: The Destination Trunk Group (DTG) information to be returned in the Contact header when the destination is used to make the routing decision.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Network Element (NE) route-related attributes including the corresponding phone numbers and the associated cost and weight. The NE name is used to identify the record to be changed. When adding a new NE route to the system, the corresponding phone numbers and the associated cost and weight are set. The NE name is used to identify the record to which a NE route is being added. The NE must be previously defined. Phone numbers are entered as a range. For example, a "from" phone number of 151400 and a "to" phone number of 151400 represent all phone numbers starting with 151400 (between 1514000 0000 and 1514009 9999).

parameter.name: ne
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting phone number of the range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending phone number of the range.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the phone number range. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: The relative value (user defined) to randomize distribution of traffic along this route.

parameter.name: farendCategory
parameter.description: This allows a route to be flagged as local. This information is used by the network server to determine if the contact to be returned requires a CIC parameter. This field is only used by the FarEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: farendDMI
parameter.description: The digit manipulation index allowing digit manipulation on the routing entry. This field is only used by the FarEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: nearendDMI
parameter.description: The digit manipulation index allowing digit manipulation on the routing entry. This field is only used by the NearEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: nearendDTG
parameter.description: The Destination Trunk Group (DTG) information to be returned in the Contact header when the originator is used to make the routing decision.

parameter.name: farendDTG
parameter.description: The Destination Trunk Group (DTG) information to be returned in the Contact header when the destination is used to make the routing decision.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Network Element (NE) route-related attributes including the corresponding phone numbers and the associated cost and weight. The Network Element (NE) name is used to identify the record to be changed. Phone numbers are entered as a range. For example, a "from" phone number of 151400 and a "to" phone number of 151400 represent all phone numbers starting with 151400 (between 1514000 0000 and 1514009 9999).

parameter.name: ne
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) name.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting phone number of the range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending phone number of the range.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost code for the phone number range. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: The relative value (user defined) to randomize distribution of traffic along this route.

parameter.name: farendCategory
parameter.description: This allows a route to be flagged as local. This information is used by the network server to determine if the contact to be returned requires a CIC parameter. This field is only used by the FarEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: farendDMI
parameter.description: The digit manipulation index allowing digit manipulation on the routing entry. This field is only used by the FarEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: nearendDMI
parameter.description: The digit manipulation index allowing digit manipulation on the routing entry. This field is only used by the NearEndRtg policy.

parameter.name: nearendDTG
parameter.description: The Destination Trunk Group (DTG) information to be returned in the Contact header when the originator is used to make the routing decision.

parameter.name: farendDTG
parameter.description: The Destination Trunk Group (DTG) information to be returned in the Contact header when the destination is used to make the routing decision.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete Network Element (NE) route-related attributes including the corresponding phone numbers and the associated cost and weight. Phone numbers can be deleted as a range. For example, a "from" phone number of 151400 and a "to" phone number of 151400 represent all phone numbers starting with 151400 (between 1514000 0000 and 1514009 9999).

parameter.name: ne

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The starting phone number of the range.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: The ending phone number of the range.

parameter.name: dmStr

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: Description of the digit manipulation string.

context.name: XSPServerFarm
context.description: This level is used to view, add, delete, and modify Xtended Services Platform farms-related attributes. An Xtended Services Platform farm model has been implemented such that the Web Portal is fully decoupled from the Application Server, thereby allowing the deployment of web portal "farms" to provide increased scalability. This model integrates a set of Web Portal hosts into a Web Portal Farm whereby each individual Web Portal is able to serve web pages for any user hosted on any Application Server in the network. The Web Portal Farm uses the Network Server as a knowledge base to locate on which Application Server a user is hosted.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Xtended Services Platform farm-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Xsp Farm.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: The Xsp Farm's description or purpose.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an Xtended Services Platform farm.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Xsp Farm.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: The Xsp Farm's description or purpose.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Xsp Farm-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Xsp Farm.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: The Xsp Farm's description or purpose.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an Xtended Services Platform farm.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Xsp Farm.

context.name: Address
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Xtended Services Platform farm addresses. An Xtended Services Platform farm is composed of nodes, which can have multiple addresses (alias and access).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Xtended Services Platform farm addresses.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Xsp Farm.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: The node's unique identification number.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The node's web address. Example: "mtlws02.mtl.broadsoft.com".

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The address type.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost, where 1 represents the lowest cost and 9 is the highest. Applies only to access-type address.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: The associated weight. Used to order results when the costs of two or more results are the same in the returned list. The higher the relative weight, the more chance this result is placed ahead in the returned list.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an Xtended Services Platform farm address.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Xsp Farm.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: The node's unique identification number.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The node's web address, for example, "mtlws02.mtl.broadsoft.com".

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This is an address of type access, for example, 192.165.15.15.

parameter.name: Access
parameter.description: The address is an Access interface and requires additional configuration.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost, where 1 represents the lowest cost and 9 is the highest. Applies only to access-type address.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: The associated weight, used to order results when the costs of two or more results are the same in the returned list. The higher the relative weight, the more chance this result is placed ahead in the returned list. Applies only to access-type address.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the general settings of the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view general attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify general attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: preferIPv4Stack
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of the java.net.preferIPv4Stack property used to start starting java processes. The default value is "true". It must be set to "false" to to use IPv6 for the process.

parameter.name: configureIPFilter
parameter.description: This parameter indicates whether or not Broadworks configure the IP filtering functionality of the OS. In case the functionality currently supported by Broadworks is not sufficient, an administrator could manually configure the IP filtering function by setting this parameter to false. When doing, the file produced by Broadworks containing the rules are still produced but are not transferred into the OS.

context.name: Licensing
context.description: This level is used to view and modify licensing settings. The use of BroadWorks and the Network Server is conditional on licensing agreements.

command.name: get
command.description: This command used to view licensing-related attributes including the type of licensing, the total amount licensed, how much has been used, and the remaining amount.

context.name: Alarm
context.description: This level is used to view and modify licensing alarms-related attributes. For example, you can set a threshold value for the percentage of license usage, that is, TPS.

command.name: get
command.description: Use this command to display licensing alarms-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: Use this command to modify licensing alarms-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: threshold
parameter.description: Sets the alarm threshold level. The threshold value is expressed as the maximum percentage of license usage (transactions per second) that can occur over a 5-second period. For example, if the license allows 100 transactions per second (500 over a five-second period), and the threshold value is set to 75, an alarm is generated when more than 375 transactions are recorded over a given 5-second period (75% of 500).

parameter.name: nonInviteThreshold
parameter.description: Sets the alarm threshold level for non-invite transactions.

context.name: LicenseManager
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the License Manager settings.

command.name: getpermission
command.description: This command forces the License Manager to execute the entire license permission request process, including the validation of the license.

command.name: showpermission
command.description: This command shows the current license permission state of the License Manager.

parameter.name: licenseProcessingPeriodInMinutes

parameter.name: highSeverityThreshold

parameter.name: criticalSeverityThreshold

However, the OSS access list must be provisioned.
