parameter.name: lastName
parameter.description: The user's last name.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: The name of the administrative level of access.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an administrator including the administrator's user ID and password, access level, as well as first and last names.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID for the administrator. Acceptable characters are letters, digits, and the following special characters: ! # $ % & + - / = ? ^ _ ` { | }. ~ @ ' *.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: Allows for complete access to the Network Server CLI and its functions.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: Allows access to the Network Server Web interface, specifically functions related to Enterprise configuration. If this level is chosen, you are required to enter the corresponding enterprise name.

parameter.name: enterpriseName
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: firstName
parameter.description: The user's first name.

parameter.name: lastName
parameter.description: The user's last name.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Administrator-related attributes including the first and last names, and password. The user ID is used to identify the record to be changed.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID for the administrator. Acceptable characters are letters, digits, and the following special characters: ! # $ % & + - / = ? ^ _ ` { | }. ~ @ ' *.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: firstName
parameter.description: The user's first name.

parameter.name: lastName
parameter.description: The user's last name.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete administrators. The user ID for the administrator is used to identify the record.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID for the administrator.

context.name: DefaultSourceID
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Default Source IDs (DefaultSourceIDs) based on a range of digits. Whenever there is no source ID defined for a given call originator (known by the Network Server), the Network Server performs a look up of the default list and tries to identify a default source ID to use.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Default Source ID (DefaultSourceID)-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: sourceid
parameter.description: The default source ID (or originating trunk group) to be used when a subscriber cannot be associated with a source ID OTG. This attribute then specifies the source ID name.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Default Source ID (DefaultSourceID)-related attributes.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: sourceid
parameter.description: The default source ID (or originating trunk group) to be used when a subscriber cannot be associated with a source ID OTG. This attribute then specifies the source ID name.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to set default Default Source ID (DefaultSourceID)-related attributes.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: sourceid
parameter.description: The default source ID (or originating trunk group) to be used when a subscriber cannot be associated with a source ID OTG. This attribute then specifies the source ID name.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a Default Source ID (DefaultSourceID).

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: Numbers starting with digits comprised in the range delimited by "from" and "to" are handled by this entry.

context.name: Devices
context.description: This level is used to add, modify, and view system access devices.

context.name: Mac
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Network Server Sync Application Programming Interface (API) to synchronize device Media Access Control (MAC) addresses and/or device user names. A MAC address is currently unique within a given Application Server. A device MAC address is also unique within a given Network Server. Trying to synchronize a MAC address that already exists will cause an error on the Application Server. A device user name is currently not unique in the context of a given Application Server. Uniqueness of a device user name is not required on the Network Server. The synchronization of the MAC addresses occurs when a MAC address is assigned, removed, or modified from a device or when a device with a MAC address is deleted. The synchronization of device user names occur when a user name is assigned to a device or to a device type and this device user name does not already exist. It also occurs when a user name is removed from a device or from a device type and this user name is not used on any other device or device type. Finally, it occurs when a device or a device type having a user name is deleted and this user name is not used for any other device or device type.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Media Access Control (MAC) address-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the device corresponding to the MAC address.

parameter.name: mac
parameter.description: The MAC address of a device.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Media Access Control (MAC) address.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the device corresponding to the MAC address.

parameter.name: mac
parameter.description: The MAC address of a device.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a Media Access Control (MAC) address.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the device corresponding to the MAC address.

parameter.name: mac
parameter.description: The MAC address of a device to be deleted.

context.name: Username
context.description: This level is used to add, modify, and remove user name devices.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view user name-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the device corresponding to the device username.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The user name corresponding to a device.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a user name.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the device corresponding to the device user name.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The user name corresponding to a device to be added.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a user name.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the device corresponding to the device user name.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The user name corresponding to a device to be deleted.

context.name: Enterprise
context.description: This level is used to view and modify enterprises. The Network Server uses the concept of an enterprise as a way to collect and organize users who share the same provisioning and routing characteristics. Private routing policies are assigned to enterprises using this level. Enterprises can be assigned routing profiles to process public calls as well as policies to process private calls. User groups allow for a further defining of an enterprise by breaking it down into smaller groups to which specific phone numbers and URLs can be assigned. It is also possible to provision a routing profile for a specific user group. The public policies used during call processing are derived from the user group's profile first and then from the enterprise's profile. A combination of both profiles is used and priority is given to the user group's profile.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view enterprise-related attributes including the carrier names for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls, the enterprise description, and the corresponding routing profile and private policies assigned to this enterprise. Use the command alone to display all records. Use the command with a specified variable to display records matching the criteria specified. For example, the Get Profile command lists all enterprises that have been assigned that profile for public calls. The Get Policy command lists all enterprises with that policy for private calls.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Filter based on an enterprise name.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The enterprise name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: callLog
parameter.description: If disabled, call logging is turned off and call processing continues to work but no logs are generated for this enterprise. If enabled, call logging feature is enabled and call-processing transactions are logged for this enterprise.

parameter.name: intraPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for intra-LATA calls.

parameter.name: interPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for inter-LATA calls.

parameter.name: intlPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for international calls.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: The routing profile for this enterprise.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The LCA name.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: Descriptive information about the enterprise.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: The originating trunk group (OTG). This is another means of identifying an enterprise, user group, or site. The same sourceId can be used to identify many enterprises, groups, or sites.

parameter.name: sourceIdForEAPrefix
parameter.description: The enterprise-specific prefix to be included in the Equal Access sourceID.

parameter.name: keepGroupsTogether
parameter.description: True if groups associated to this enterprise should all be on the same HostingNE node part of the enterprise's set. False if groups associated to this enterprise should be distributed individually on different HostingNE nodes part of the enterprise's set.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The enterprise name.

parameter.name: policy
parameter.description: The policies to be used to process private calls.

parameter.name: hostingNESetName
parameter.description: This is the name of the Hosting NE set in which the enterprise belongs.

parameter.name: subscriberMaintenancePartitionName
parameter.description: This is the name of the Subscriber Maintenance Partition to which the enterprise belongs.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an enterprise including the enterprise name. The carrier names for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls for that enterprise, as well as the routing profile for the enterprise and the enterprise description, can also be assigned at this time. NOTE: Carrier names used here must be previously defined. The routing profile to be used for this enterprise must also exist. Assigning private policies to enterprises is not performed at this level.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the new enterprise.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: intraPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for intra-LATA calls.

parameter.name: interPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for inter-LATA calls.

parameter.name: intlPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for international calls.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: The routing profile for this enterprise.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The LCA name.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: Descriptive information about the enterprise.

parameter.name: callLog
parameter.description: If disabled, call logging is turned off and call processing continues to work but no logs are generated for this enterprise. If enabled, call logging feature is enabled and call-processing transactions are logged for this enterprise.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: The originating trunk group (OTG). This is another means of identifying an enterprise, user group, or site. The same sourceID can be used to identify many enterprises, groups, or sites.

parameter.name: sourceIdForEAPrefix
parameter.description: The enterprise-specific prefix to be included in the Equal Access sourceID.

parameter.name: keepGroupsTogether
parameter.description: True if groups associated to this enterprise should all be on the same HostingNE node part of the enterprise's set. False if groups associated to this enterprise should be distributed individually on different HostingNE nodes part of the enterprise's set.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify enterprise-related attributes including the carrier names for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls, the enterprise description, and the corresponding routing profile for the enterprise. The enterprise name is used to identify the record to be changed. NOTE: The carrier names used here must be previously defined. The routing profile to be used for this enterprise must also exist. Changing the private policies assigned to enterprises is not performed at this level.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The enterprise name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: callLog
parameter.description: If disabled, call logging is turned off and call processing continues to work but no logs are generated for this enterprise. If enabled, call logging feature is enabled and call-processing transactions are logged for this enterprise.

parameter.name: intraPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for intra-LATA calls.

parameter.name: interPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for inter-LATA calls.

parameter.name: intlPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for international calls.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: The routing profile for this enterprise.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The LCA name.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: Descriptive information about the enterprise.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: The originating trunk group (OTG). This is another means of identifying an enterprise, user group, or site. The same sourceID can be used to identify many enterprises, groups, or sites.

parameter.name: sourceIdForEAPrefix
parameter.description: The enterprise-specific prefix to be included in the Equal Access sourceID.

parameter.name: keepGroupsTogether
parameter.description: True if groups associated to this enterprise should all be on the same HostingNE node part of the enterprise's set. False if groups associated to this enterprise should be distributed individually on different HostingNE nodes part of the enterprise's set.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an enterprise. The enterprise name is used to delete the associated record.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The enterprise name.

command.name: migrate
command.description: This command is used to migrate an enterprise to another node in its current hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: Name of the enterprise to migrate.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Node ID of the current enterprise Hosting NE to which all the members of the enterprise should be migrated to.

context.name: Administrator
context.description: This level is used to view, add, and delete hosting Network Element (NE) enterprise administrators.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the administrators of an enterprise.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the Enterprise to view the administrators.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of the hosting Network Element (NE).

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an enterprise user administrator.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the Enterprise.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The hosting NE to which the administrator is added.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID for the administrator. Acceptable characters are letters, digits, and the following special characters: ! # $ % & + - / = ? ^ _` { | }. ~ @ ' *.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an enterprise administrator.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the Enterprise.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The hosting NE from which the administrator is deleted.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID of the administrator to delete.

context.name: DefaultPoliciesOnSync
context.description: This level is used to view, add, and delete default private policy names.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the configurable list of default private policies.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new policy to the list of default policies.

parameter.name: policy
parameter.description: The name of the new policy selected from the following choices: EntMediaSrvSel EntNGWRouting EntSIMPLE EntSubLocation ExtDialing FarEndHopOff voiceVPN.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a policy from the list of default policies.

parameter.name: policy
parameter.description: The name of the new policy selected from the following choices: EntMediaSrvSel EntNGWRouting EntSIMPLE EntSubLocation ExtDialing FarEndHopOff voiceVPN.

context.name: DnUrl
context.description: This level is used to display, add, modify, and delete the attributes related to phone numbers (directory numbers or DNs), URLs, and extensions for enterprises.

command.name: get
command.description: This command to view the Directory Numbers (DNs), mobileDNs, URLs, and extensions related to an enterprise. Using the command alone displays all records. Using the command with a specific variable displays records matching those criteria. Either DNs, mobileDNs, URLs or extensions or all can be associated with a user group. DNs, mobileDNs and extensions are displayed as either a list of individual DNs/mobileDNs/extensions or a range of DNs/mobileDNs/extensions.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: The user alias.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise.

parameter.name: dnType
parameter.description: The type of DN. Can either be hosted or external. Hosted represents a user that is hosted by BroadWorks, while external indicates a user that is recognized but not hosted by BroadWorks.

command.name: detail
command.description: This command is used to view the details for the extensions, DNs, mobileDNs and URLs.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: The user's alias.

parameter.name: dnType
parameter.description: When set to hosted, indicates a user that is hosted by BroadWorks. When set to external, indicates a user that is recognized but not hosted by BroadWorks.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the user.

parameter.name: overflow
parameter.description: When set to false, the overflow routing is disabled for the specified user of the group. When set to true, the overflow routing is enabled for the specified user of the group.

parameter.name: isLoginId
parameter.description: When set to false, indicates that the alias is used as the user's login ID. When set to true, indicates the alias is not used as the user's login ID.

parameter.name: isOffNet
parameter.description: When set to false, indicates DNs that are "on-net", assigned and activated. When set to true, indicates DNs that are "off-net", assigned but not activated.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add Directory Numbers (DNs), mobileDNs, URLs, and extensions to a user group. The unique user group name and hosting Network Element (NE) combination is used to identify the associated record. More than one DN, mobileDN, URL, or extension can be specified. DNs, mobileDNs and extensions can be entered as individual DNs/mobileDNs/extensions or as a range of DNs/mobileDNs/extensions. When adding a DN, mobileDN, URL, or an extension to a record, the new DN, mobileDN, URL, or extension is appended to the current list of DNs, mobileDNs, URLs, and extensions for that record.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: Type of entry to add.

parameter.name: dn
parameter.description: List of DNs to be added to the system (Separated by a space or a comma for individual DNs or by a hyphen for a range of DNs).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: isOffNet
parameter.description: When set to false, indicates DNs that are "on-net", assigned and activated. When set to true, indicates DNs that are "off-net", assigned but not activated.

parameter.name: mobileDn
parameter.description: List of mobileDNs to be added to the system (Separated by a space or a comma for individual mobileDNs or by a hyphen for a range of mobileDNs).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: ext
parameter.description: List of extensions, separated by a space or a comma for individual extensions or by a hyphen for a range of extensions, for example {34564 34455 34556-34566}.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: loginIdUrl
parameter.description: List of login ID URLs (separated by a space or a comma), for example, {mtl1111@mtl.bs.com maryt@broadsoft.com}.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: aliasUrl
parameter.description: A list of the alias URLs, separated by a space of a comma.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Directory Numbers (DNs), mobileDNs, URLs, and extensions associated with user groups. The unique user group name and hosting Network Element (NE) combination is used to identify the associated record. More than one DN or mobileDN or URL or extension can be specified. DNs, mobileDNs and extensions can be entered as individual DNs/mobileDNs/extensions or as a range of DNs/mobileDNs /extensions. When changing a DN, mobileDN, URL or an extension, all current DNs, mobileDNs, URLs, or extensions for that record are replaced with the new DN(s), mobileDN(s), URL(s), or extension(s).

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: Type of entry to modify.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the address that is modified.

parameter.name: dn
parameter.description: List of DNs to be modified in the system (Separated by a space or a comma for individual DNs or by a hyphen for a range of DNs).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: isOffNet
parameter.description: When set to false, indicates DNs that are "on-net", assigned and activated. When set to true, indicates DNs that are "off-net", assigned but not activated.

parameter.name: mobileDn
parameter.description: List of mobileDNs to be modified in the system (Separated by a space or a comma for individual mobileDNs or by a hyphen for a range of mobileDNs).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: ext
parameter.description: List of extensions, separated by a space or a comma for individual extensions or by a hyphen for a range of extensions, for example {34564 34455 34556-34566}.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: loginIdUrl
parameter.description: List of login ID URLs (separated by a space or a comma), for example, {mtl1111@mtl.bs.com maryt@broadsoft.com}.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: aliasUrl
parameter.description: A list of the alias URLs, separated by a space of a comma.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The specific site of the enterprise to which the elements are to be assigned.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete Directory Numbers (DNs), mobileDNs, URLs, and extensions can be deleted from a user group using this command. The unique user group name and hosting Network Element (NE) combination is used to identify the associated record. More than one DN, mobileDN, URL, or extension can be specified. DNs, mobileDNs and extensions can be entered as individual DNs, mobileDNs and extensions or as a range of DNs/mobileDNs/extensions. When deleting a DN, mobileDN, URL, or an extension from a record, only the specified DN, mobileDN, URL, or extension is removed from the current list of DNs, mobileDNs, URLs, and extensions for that record.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: Type of entry to delete.

parameter.name: dn
parameter.description: List of DNs to be removed from the user group (Separated by a space or a comma for individual DNs or by a hyphen for a range of DNs).

parameter.name: mobileDn
parameter.description: List of mobileDNs to be deleted from the system (Separated by a space or a comma for individual mobileDNs or by a hyphen for a range of mobileDNs).

parameter.name: ext
parameter.description: List of extensions, separated by a space or a comma for individual extensions or by a hyphen for a range of extensions, for example {34564 34455 34556-34566}.

parameter.name: loginIdUrl
parameter.description: List of login ID URLs (separated by a space or a comma), for example, {mtl1111@mtl.bs.com maryt@broadsoft.com}.

parameter.name: aliasUrl
parameter.description: A list of the alias URLs, separated by a space of a comma.

command.name: setOverflow
command.description: This command is used to enable or disable overflow routing for specified enterprise phone numbers.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: overflowEnabled
parameter.description: The overflow routing is disabled for the specified number of the group.

parameter.name: DN
parameter.description: The phone numbers for which overflow routing should be enabled or disabled.

context.name: AutoMigrate
context.description: This level is used to view and modify auto-migration settings. Auto-migration allows the Network Server to automatically update the active node setting for a DN. However, some directory numbers, such as a virtual directory number, should not be automatically migrated. This level is used to decide whether a directory number (DN) can be migrated automatically by setting the migration capability on a DN-basis. A DN that is set to migrate will be automatically migrated whenever the DN originates a call from a new node of the hosting NE. A DN that is set so that it does not migrate will not be automatically migrated by the Network Server and remains assigned to the default node of the hosting Network Element (NE).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view auto-migration attributes.

parameter.name: dn
parameter.description: The directory number.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify auto-migration attributes.

parameter.name: dn
parameter.description: The directory number.

parameter.name: migratable
parameter.description: True indicates the directory number can be migrated automatically. False indicates it cannot be migrated automatically.

context.name: LinePort
context.description: This level is used to view and modify line/port data in the Network Server database. As in the Application Server, a line/port belongs to a user. In the Network Server, a user is identified by a login ID alias. A login ID alias can have 0, 1, or more associated line/ports, but a line/port is only associated with one login ID alias. A line/port in the Network Server is a string formatted as "linePortAddress@linePortDomain". This is how a line/port is identified when using one of the provisioning interfaces. The "linePortDomain" is either a domain name provisioned on the Application Server or the address or host name of an access device provisioned on the Application Server. The Network Server does not enforce a "linePortDomain" to be used by only one Application Server. However, the Network Server currently imposes a limit of 32768 distinct domain names in its database. The feature corrects this limitation to allow a larger number of domain names. A line/port such as "linePortAddress@linePortDomain" has to be unique in the system, no other line/port can have the same name, and line/ports are not case-sensitive (so a@b is considered the same as A@B). The Network Server enforces this and returns an error if an "add" or "modify" command from any provisioning interface attempts to re-use an existing line/port.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view line/port data-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The name of a user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The name of a hosting Network Element (NE) node.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The enterprise name.

parameter.name: loginIdUrl
parameter.description: The user login ID alias, for example, mariabuena@linsanity.mtl.broadsoft.com.

parameter.name: linePortAddress
parameter.description: The address of a line/port, which is the first part of the line port name. For example, address of "2025564005@linsanity.mtl.broadsoft.com" line/port is "2025564005".

parameter.name: linePortDomain
parameter.description: The line/port domain. For example, the domain of the "2025564005@linsanity.mtl.broadsoft.com" line/port is "linsanity.mtl.broadsoft.com".

parameter.name: supportsOrigDiversion
parameter.description: Specifies whether a PBX integration line/port is allowed to initiate an originating diverted call towards the Application Server (also known as PBX deflection).

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new line/port.

parameter.name: loginIdUrl
parameter.description: The user login ID alias of the user who owns the line/port.

parameter.name: linePort
parameter.description: The line/port name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: supportsOrigDiversion
parameter.description: Specifies whether a PBX integration line/port is allowed to initiate an originating diverted call towards the Application Server (also known as PBX deflection).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify line/port-related attributes.

parameter.name: currentLinePort
parameter.description: The current line/port name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: newLinePort
parameter.description: The new line/port name.

parameter.name: supportsOrigDiversion
parameter.description: Specifies whether a PBX integration line/port is allowed to initiate an originating diverted call towards the Application Server (also known as PBX deflection).

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing line/port.

parameter.name: linePort
parameter.description: The name of the line/port to be deleted.

context.name: TrunkGroup
context.description: This level is used to view and modify trunk group data in the Network Server database. As in the Application Server, a trunk group belongs to a group. In the Network Server, a group is identified by the combination of a group ID and a Hosting NE. A trunk group in the Network Server is uniquely identified by its name, along with the group ID and Hosting NE it belongs to. Properties configured for each trunk group include the trunk group identity and the OTG/DTG identity. If specified, these identities must be unique. Setting the same trunk group identity for two trunk groups results in an error. Setting the same OTG/DTG identity in two trunk groups also results in an error. A trunk group identity is a string formatted as "alias@domain".

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view trunk group-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Trunk Group to view.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The ID of the user group the Trunk Group belongs to.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: The trunk group identity, including the domain name.

parameter.name: otgDtgIdentity
parameter.description: The trunk group OTG/DTG identity.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new trunk group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Trunk Group to add.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The ID of the user group the Trunk Group belongs to.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: The trunk group identity, including the domain name.

parameter.name: otgDtgIdentity
parameter.description: The trunk group OTG/DTG identity.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify trunk group-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Trunk Group to modify.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The ID of the user group the Trunk Group belongs to.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: The trunk group identity, including the domain name.

parameter.name: otgDtgIdentity
parameter.description: The trunk group OTG/DTG identity.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing trunk group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the Trunk Group to delete.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The ID of the user group the Trunk Group belongs to.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the group.

context.name: EnterpriseTrunkNumberRange
context.description: This level is used to view, add, delete, and modify enterprise trunk number ranges.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the enterprise trunk number ranges in the Network Server. Use the command alone to display all ranges. Use the command with specific parameters to display ranges matching the criteria.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: numberRangeStartPrefix
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the search criteria to display ranges with range start numbers beginning with the specified prefix.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the search criteria to display ranges allocated to the specified service provider/enterprise.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the search criteria to display ranges hosted by the specified Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the search criteria to display ranges set to a specified site.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the search criteria to display ranges assigned to a specified user group. To specifiy the search criteria to display ranges not assigned to any user group, set this parameter to an empty string.

parameter.name: isOffNet
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the search criteria to display ranges with the specified off-net status.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a list of enterprise trunk number ranges to a service provider or enterprise at a hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the service provider/enterprise that the ranges are added to.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Network Element (NE) that the ranges are hosted by.

parameter.name: range
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a list of enterprise trunk number ranges to add.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional optional attributes to set for the new ranges.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: This parameter set the ranges to the specified site. If this parameter is not set, ranges will be set to the default site of the enterprise.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter assigns the ranges to the specified user group. If this parameter is not set, no group assignment will be made for the ranges.

parameter.name: isOffNet
parameter.description: This parameter sets the ranges to be on-net or off-net. If this parameter is not set, ranges will be default to off-net.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the site, group, and off-net attributes for the specified enterprise trunk number ranges.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the service provider/enterprise that the modifying ranges belong to.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Network Element (NE) that the modifying ranges belong to.

parameter.name: range
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a list of the start DNs of enterprise trunk number ranges to modify.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the group to assign the ranges to.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the site of service provider/enterprise to set the ranges to.

parameter.name: isOffNet
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the off-net status to modify the ranges to.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a list of enterprise trunk number ranges from a hosting Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the service provider/enterprise that the ranges are deleted from.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Network Element (NE) that the ranges are deleted from.

parameter.name: range
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a list of the start DNs of enterprise trunk number ranges to delete.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear group assignment for multiple enterprise trunk number ranges.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the service provider/enterprise that the ranges belong to.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Network Element (NE) that the ranges belong to.

parameter.name: range
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a list of the start DNs of enterprise trunk number ranges to clear the group assignment.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of the attribute to clear.

context.name: Policy
context.description: This level is used to view and modify specific policies. These policies, which are specific to enterprises, include the following: Enterprise Media Server Selection, Enterprise Network Gateway Routing, Enterprise SIMPLE, Enterprise Subscriber Location, Extension Dialing, Far-End Hop-Off, and Voice VPN.

context.name: EntMediaSrvSel
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Enterprise Media Server Selection (EntMediaSrvSel) policy to define Media Server selection rules for an enterprise. The purpose of this policy is to return Media Servers (to the top of the list), which are best suited to process RTP streams for a source that belongs to an enterprise. The Enterprise Media Server Selection policy is the enterprise equivalent to the Media Server Selection (MediaSrvSel) routing policy. You define the Media Servers used by EntMediaSrvSel (and MediaSrvSel) as resource Network Element (NE)s of type "media", from the NS_CLI/System/Device/ResourceNE level. The EntMediaSrvSel level is used to view, add, modify, and delete instances and attributes of the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view a Enterprise Media Server Selection policy instances and their attributes.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an instance of the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: When set to false, the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy is disabled for this enterprise. When set to true, the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy is enabled for this enterprise.

parameter.name: breakAfterProcessing
parameter.description: When set to false, continue with call processing to allow other policies to add contacts to the 302 message whether or not a contact was added. When set to true, if a contact is added, stop processing the call and immediately send back a 302 message with the result from the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the attributes of the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Attribute to modify.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: When set to false, the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy is disabled for this enterprise. When set to true, the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy is enabled for this enterprise.

parameter.name: breakAfterProcessing
parameter.description: When set to false, continue with call processing to allow other policies to add contacts to the 302 message whether or not a contact was added. When set to true, if a contact is added, stop processing the call and immediately send back a 302 message with the result from the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an instance of the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

context.name: SiteList
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, or delete site lists associated with the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the attributes of site lists associated with the Enterprise Media Server Selection policy.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Attribute to filter on.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The name of the site.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services.

parameter.name: neType
parameter.description: The type of resource Network Element (NE).

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new site list entry.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The name of the site.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost. 1 is the lowest cost (preferred Media Server) while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: The associated weight. Used to order results when the costs of two or more results are the same in the returned list. The higher the relative weight, the more chance this result is listed ahead in the returned list.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional optional attributes.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services. This is required for ms resource Network Element (NE) but not required for uvs resource Network Element (NE). Service "cfw-collab" is assigned by default for uvs resource Network Element (NE).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the attributes of an existing site list.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The name of the site.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Attribute to modify.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services. This is required for ms resource Network Element (NE) but not required for uvs resource Network Element (NE). Service "cfw-collab" is assigned by default for uvs resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The associated cost. 1 is the lowest cost while 9 is the highest.

parameter.name: weight
parameter.description: The associated weight. Used to order results when the costs of two or more results are the same in the returned list. The higher the relative weight, the more chance this result is placed ahead in the returned list.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a site list entry.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: site
parameter.description: The name of the site.

parameter.name: neName
parameter.description: The name of the resource Network Element (NE).

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional optional attributes used to filter the delete command.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: All possible media services. This is required for ms resource Network Element (NE) but not required for uvs resource Network Element (NE). Service "cfw-collab" is assigned by default for uvs resource Network Element (NE).

context.name: EntNGWRouting

parameter.name: enterprise

parameter.name: breakAfterProcessing
parameter.description: Continue with call processing to allow other policies to add contacts to the 302 message whether or not a contact was added.

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: When set to false, the Enterprise Network Gateway Routing policy is disabled for this enterprise. When set to true, the Enterprise Network Gateway Routing policy is enabled for this enterprise.

parameter.description: Continue with call processing to allow other policies to add contacts to the 302 message whether or not a contact was added.

parameter.name: enterprise

context.name: AuthHost

command.name: get

command.description: This command is used to add properties related to the Enterprise Network Gateway Routing policy.

parameter.name: desc

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify property attributes related to the Enterprise Network Gateway Routing policy.

context.name: RoutingList

parameter.name: calltype

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a routing list associated with the Enterprise Network Gateway Routing policy.

parameter.name: enterprise

parameter.name: site

parameter.name: calltype
parameter.description: The type of call this policy instance can process.

parameter.name: authHost

parameter.name: cost

context.name: EntSubLocation
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Enterprise Subscriber Location (EntSubLocation) routing policy to route calls within the same enterprise using the hosting Network Element (NE) as the destination. Using the enterprise of the caller, the policy searches through the DNs and URLs defined for this enterprise (in its user groups) and looks for a match with the called DN or URL. If one is found, the call is sent to the corresponding user group hosting Network Element (NE).Site-specific subscriber location is supported by enabling the intraSiteOnly option in the Enterprise Subscriber Location policy instance. This level is used to view, add, modify, and delete Enterprise Subscriber Location policy instances.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display the enterprise instances of the Enterprise Subscriber Location (EntSubLocation) policy.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

command.name: add
command.description: The command is used to add an Enterprise Subscriber Location (EntSubLocation) policy instance.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: When set to false, the Enterprise Subscriber Location policy is disabled for this enterprise. When set to true, the Enterprise Subscriber Location policy is enabled for this enterprise.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional optional attributes.

parameter.name: intraSiteOnly
parameter.description: Site-specific subscriber location is disabled. Default enterprise-wide subscriber location behavior applies.

parameter.name: supportTrunkGroupLookups
parameter.description: When set to "disable", the policy instance ignores any tgrp or dtg parameters in the SIP request. When set to "enablePermissive", and if the SIP request has a tgrp or dtg parameter, the policy instance attempts a trunk group lookup. If the lookup fails, route processing continues as if no tgrp or dtg were present. When set to "enableRestrictive", and if the SIP request has a tgrp or dtg parameter, the policy instance attempts a trunk group lookup. If the lookup fails, route processing ends and the Network Server applies the User Not Found treatment.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Enterprise Subscriber Location (EntSubLocation) attributes:

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Attribute to modify.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: When set to false, the Enterprise Subscriber Location policy is disabled for this enterprise. When set to true, the Enterprise Subscriber Location policy is enabled for this enterprise.

parameter.name: intraSiteOnly
parameter.description: Site-specific subscriber location is disabled. Default enterprise-wide subscriber location behavior applies.

parameter.name: supportTrunkGroupLookups
parameter.description: When set to "disable", the policy instance ignores any tgrp or dtg parameters in the SIP request. When set to "enablePermissive", and if the SIP request has a tgrp or dtg parameter, the policy instance attempts a trunk group lookup. If the lookup fails, route processing continues as if no tgrp or dtg were present. When set to "enableRestrictive", and if the SIP request has a tgrp or dtg parameter, the policy instance attempts a trunk group lookup. If the lookup fails, route processing ends and the Network Server applies the User Not Found treatment.

command.name: delete
command.description: The command is used to delete an Enterprise Subscriber Location (EntSubLocation) instance.

parameter.name: enterprise
parameter.description: The name of the enterprise.

context.name: ExtDialing
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Enterprise Extension Dialing (ExtDialing) routing policy to support private extension dialing. As opposed to VoiceVPN, which is an enterprise-level policy, this policy is only triggered at the userGroup level. Upon receiving the privately dialed call, identified through the phone-context, which includes the name of the Application Server group, this policy applies the same processing as the Application Server extension dialing service. This level is used to view, add, modify, or delete Enterprise Extension Dialing policy instances.

context.name: FarEndHopOff
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Far-End Hop-Off (FarEndHopOff) routing policy to allow enterprises to use their own facilities to terminate public calls. This policy allows an enterprise to identify routes that will be used to terminate public calls. This is way for an enterprise to perform "toll bypass".The Far-End Hop-Off policy is used to enter routing lists and authorized hosts for the specified enterprises. This allows the administrator to define, for each enterprise and policy type, a subset of all the hosting Network Elements (NEs) configured in the Network Server. Therefore, a private policy for an enterprise can only use the hosting NEs that have been previously authorized through Auth Host. This level is used to view, add, modify, or delete Far-End Hop-Off policy instances.

context.name: voiceVPN
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Voice Virtual Private Network (VoiceVPN) routing policy. The VoiceVPN allows for a virtual private network where extension dialing across sites is available. The Voice VPN policy allows for the entry of dial plans per enterprise as well as Voice VPN-wide properties. The data set under the Properties level affects the Voice VPN policy, and not specific instances of this policy. Currently, the only Voice VPN properties you can configure are used to define the set of treatments allowed for referencing by instances of Voice VPN. The authorized treatments can also be assigned a description that is then used by the web client to better describe the treatments themselves. This level is used to view, add, modify, and delete Voice VPN-related information.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: When set to false, the Enterprise Voice VPN policy is disabled for this enterprise. When set to true, the Enterprise Voice VPN policy is enabled for this enterprise.

parameter.name: dfltSel
parameter.description: The default sector for the calls for this enterprise.

parameter.name: processE164AsPublic
parameter.description: If true, route processing continues with the network selector set to PUBLIC, regardless of the setting of the default selector.

parameter.name: usePhoneContext
parameter.description: Specifies whether the phone-context is required by the VoiceVPN policy.

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: Defines the translation behavior for a call if this there is a match for this entry: *PRIVATE: Use only private policies to process calls. *PUBLIC: Continue through all available policies starting with private policies first, then public ones. *ROUTE: Route calls with redirect. *TRMT: Treat calls using the corresponding treatment (trmtID).

parameter.description: The digit manipulation string.

parameter.description: The hosting Network Element (NE). (Can only be changed when the selector is ROUTE and is mandatory).

parameter.name: grpId
parameter.description: The group ID. (Can only be changed when the selector is ROUTE and is mandatory).

parameter.name: trmtId
parameter.description: The error code of the treatment to be used. (Can only be changed when the selector is TRMT).

parameter.name: desc
parameter.description: The description of the dial plan entry.

parameter.description: Defines the translation behavior for a call if this there is a match for this entry: *PRIVATE: Use only private policies to process calls. *PUBLIC: Continue through all available policies starting with private policies first, then public ones. *ROUTE: Route calls with redirect. *TRMT: Treat calls using the corresponding treatment (trmtID).

parameter.name: dm
parameter.description: The digit manipulation string.

parameter.name: hostId
parameter.description: The hosting Network Element (NE). (Can only be changed when the selector is ROUTE and is mandatory).

parameter.description: The error code of the treatment to be used. (Can only be changed when the selector is TRMT).

context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, and delete user group attributes, such as the user group name, the carrier names for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls, the user group description, the corresponding enterprise, and the digit manipulation algorithm for incoming calls for the user group. The carriers assigned for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls at the user group level take precedence over those assigned for the corresponding enterprise.

parameter.name: hostNE

command.description: This command is used to add a user group. When adding a new user group to the system, the user group name and hosting Network Element (NE) are set. The carrier names for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls for that user group, the user group description, and corresponding enterprise for that user group, and the digit manipulation algorithm for incoming calls for the user group, can also be assigned at this time. The carriers assigned for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls at the user group level take precedence over those assigned for the corresponding enterprise. NOTE: Carrier names used here must be previously defined. The hosting Network Element (NE) also must be defined as a system Network Element (NE).

parameter.description: The LCA name.

parameter.name: intraPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for intra-LATA calls.

parameter.name: interPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for inter-LATA calls.

parameter.name: intlPic
parameter.description: The carrier to be used for international calls.

parameter.name: InDM
parameter.description: The digit manipulation algorithm for incoming calls to the user group.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: The originating trunk group (OTG). This is another means of identifying an enterprise, user group, or site. The same sourceID can be used to identify many enterprises, groups, or sites.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the user group attributes including the carrier names for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls, the user group enterprise, and the digit manipulation algorithm for incoming calls for the user group. The carriers assigned for intra-LATA, inter-LATA, and international calls at the user group level take precedence over those assigned for the enterprise. The user group name and hosting Network Element (NE) combination is used to identify the record to be changed. "NOTE": Carrier names and hosting Network Elements (NEs) must be previously defined.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The ID of the user group.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.description: The routing profile to be used by the user group.

parameter.name: lcaid
parameter.description: The LCA name.

parameter.name: intraPic
parameter.description: Carrier to be used for intra-LATA calls.

parameter.name: interPic
parameter.description: Carrier to be used for inter-LATA calls.

parameter.name: intlPic
parameter.description: Carrier to be used for international calls.

parameter.name: InDM
parameter.description: The digit manipulation algorithm for incoming calls to the user group.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: The originating trunk group (OTG), a different way of identifying an enterprise, user group, or site. The same sourceId can be used to identify many enterprises, groups, or sites.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a user group. The unique user group name and hosting Network Element (NE) combination is used to delete the associated record.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the user group.

command.name: migrate
command.description: This command is used to migrate a user group to another node in its current Hosting NE.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: Id of the user group to migrate.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: Name of the Hosting NE on which the group is currently hosted.

parameter.name: nodeID
parameter.description: Node ID of the current user group Hosting NE to which all members of the user group should be migrated to.

context.name: Administrator
context.description: This level is used to view, add, and delete hosting Network Element (NE) group administrators.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the administrators of a group.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the user group.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a group user administrator.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the user group.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID for the administrator. Acceptable characters are letters, digits, and the following special characters: ! # $ % & + - / = ? ^ _` { | }. ~ @ ' *.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a group administrator.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The name of the user group.

parameter.name: hostNE
parameter.description: The Network Element (NE) hosting the user group.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID of the administrator to delete.

context.name: MaxFailedLoginAttempts
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the maximum failed login attempt settings. Each unsuccessful login attempt is logged in the audit trail. Also, a system level alarm is triggered when the number of failed login attempts exceeds a user-defined limit. This level is used to view and modify the maximum number of failed attempts.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display the current settings for maximum failed login attempts.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the current settings of maximum failed login attempts.

parameter.name: MaxFailedLoginAttempts
parameter.description: The maximum number of times users can enter incorrect login information in. The default is 100.

context.name: MinLoginIdLength
context.description: This level is used to determine the minimum length for user IDs. For security purposes, it may be required that user IDs are a specific length.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the minimum length required for user IDs.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the minimum length required for user IDs.

parameter.name: MinLoginIdLength
parameter.description: The minimum length of a system user's login ID. The default is 6.

context.name: NetworkTranslationIndex
